story:
SLIM AND STYLISH -Designed Quick Access ID Windows, Comfortably holds 8 - 10 cards plus US bills with no bulk, and a minimal Pull-tab design to reduce bulk. 

GENUINE LEATHER - Hand crafted with the finest full grain cowhide leather, looks classy and very slim, Wallet Size: 4" in. x 3" in. .4" in.

 

 

 

 
 

Personal cards that currently use RFID Blocking technology include credit cards, transit payment cards, and identification cards such as enhanced driver's licenses. It does not shield against some cards like hotel key cards and company key cards that operate at low frequencies of 125 kHz.

story:
INTRODUCING ORA

Smart Jewelry that keeps you safe.

With the push of a button, ORA sends instant emergency notifications to your network of contacts. Customized jewelry and 911 backup sets ORA apart from all others.

 

 

 

 

ORA IS FOR EVERYONE

There really is no limit to whom ORA can help. Whether it is to provide assistance in the event of a safety or medical emergency, or just to reach out for help when a phone isn't readily available, ORA can help anyone Live Without Limits. 

For professionals who work alone, ORA is discreet and elegant. 

 

         Women who want to live without limits or fear; when walking at night on campus, going on a date, or for a run.

 

Individuals with health challenges appreciate an easy way to notify friends and family.

 

Active older adults who are independent (and want to keep it that way) enjoy the stylish designs, enhanced features, and the simple fact it doesn't look like a medical alert device!

 

HOW ORA WORKS

 

 

The Link is where the 'magic' happens. It is the technology and the alert button. The Link fits into your choice of jewelry and sportswear. When you set it up, you pair it with the ORA App, which is your connection to your support network. When you press the button, the ORA App sends an alert to your support network. You can pick whomever, and as many people, as you want. 

 

Help is only a button push away.

 

 

When you press the button, your phone will sound a loud alarm, which can help to deter would be attackers. Your support network will be alerted that you need help, and the live map will show them where you are. If no one is available, your smartphone automatically calls 911 as a backup. This is one of the major differences between ORA and all the others.

No worries if it's a false alarm - you can easily cancel the emergency from the ORA App. 

 

The Link: small but mighty!

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Link is small, but powerful! Your smartphone's Bluetooth connects to the Link, and the simple magnetic charger means you never have to worry about replacing a battery. The Link fits in a wide selection of custom designed and specially handcrafted jewelry and sportswear, so you can change your look every day. 

 

The Link fits in the Flex.

 

The Link fits in the Teardrop.

 

The Teardrop Covers are Interchangeable.

There are currently 4 color choices for the Teardrop cover. The covers are interchangeable with the silver Teardrop, so you can change them to match what you are wearing. Each one is handcrafted, which means no two are alike! Additional covers can be purchased separately. 

We are working to add more cover options in different colors and materials, necklace and earring options, as well as offering the Teardrop in other metals such as gold and rose gold. Eventually you will have an entire catalog of jewelry options to choose from!

 

 

No Limits - ORA Works Anywhere.

Since ORA communicates through the ORA smartphone app, you are protected wherever there is cell phone coverage, with any cellular carrier. Whether you’re out for a walk, shopping, or out with friends, you’re protected by ORA. ORA even works when you are travelling, in any country with 911 emergency services.

 

 

 

 

 

    TIMELINE

    ORA is past the prototyping stages and has already saved a life!  Look how far we've come!

    We have already built our first run of devices, we just need your help to get to the next level. Buy an ORA for yourself, for a loved one, or for your office; help others by giving to the matching gift, where we will give ORA to people in need; or just donate to our campaign for a shoutout. Anything you can do to back us would be greatly appreciated!

     

    TECH SPECS

     

     

    FAQs

    Does ORA require a subscription and what do I get for it?

    Yes, a subscription is required for your ORA to work properly and it is $14.99 per month or $149.95 per year. All perks come with 3 months subscription included. We recommend you also consider purchasing a year in advance at a discount - that's another exclusive perk here on Indiegogo!  

    Subscriptions includes: 

    • Unlimited Alerts 
    • Unlimited number of emergency contacts 
    • Patent pending 911 emergency response 
    • ORA low battery indicator 
    • Inactivity tracking reporting 
    • Chat function for support network members

     

    How is ORA different than medical alert or PERS devices?

    There are many reasons why ORA is different, besides how great it looks! Firstly, traditional devices typically only work in the home and yard, whereas ORA works wherever there is cellular coverage. In addition, the alerts go to your network of friends and family, instead of a stranger in a call center. Your network also has access to a dashboard of information on their app, including connection details and inactivity, something other devices do not have. Finally, when you purchase ORA, it is yours to keep and the monthly subscription is very competitive. There are no contracts or hidden fees.

     

    How does the donation perk work - how do you decide who gets an ORA?

    For every $120 raised from the "Help Someone in Need" perk, an ORA Flex package, along with $120 in subscription (for a full 12 months coverage), will be donated to someone in need. We will be reaching out to the ORA community for nominations on individuals who should be considered. From those nominations, we will select deserving recipients. Want to nominate someone? Send us a message at support@oraforyou.com.

     

    Do I need an ORA Link for each piece of jewelry?  

    Nope. You only need one ORA Link, and you can swap it in and out of every piece of ORA compatible jewelry and sportswear. The Flex is great for everyday wear, including sleeping, bathing, and exercising, and then you can change to the Teardrop when you want to dress up.

     

    Does ORA have fall detection?

    Fall detection is currently not a feature of ORA. Our research indicated that automatic fall detection is largely unreliable, and the feedback from older adults from our focus groups reinforced this. Those who owned devices with automatic fall detection told us there were many times when they didn't fall but the device went off, which was not only annoying for them and their loved ones, it also caused them to not want to wear the device. This is the worst possible scenario, since wearables are only useful if people wear them! 

    Instead, ORA offers 'inactivity monitoring'. With a quick check in the ORA App, the support network can see if the wearer is wearing ORA, if it is charged and connected, and if the wearer has moved or has been inactive for extended periods. If you see the wearer hasn't moved in a while, this could be an indication you should give them a call.

     

    Do I need a smartphone?

    Yes, the ORA Link pairs with a compatible smartphone that has an active cellular and data connection. The support network contacts do not require a smartphone, however if a regular cell phone is used, only texts will be received as the other features (notifications, GPS location, inactivity) can only be accessed through the ORA App.

     

    How long does the battery last?

    Your ORA Link will last a full 24 hours (depending on usage) before needing to be recharged. You should charge your ORA every day or night, just like your smartphone. ORA can't help you in an emergency if your Link or smartphone are not charged! It should only take a couple hours to charge your Link. You’ll know it’s fully charged by the solid green light on your Link. The simple magnetic charger is included with your purchase of any ORA package.

     

    Is there a warranty?

    We offer a one-year warranty for the Link. Please email support@oraforyou.com if you would like a copy of our warranty policy.

     

    Who can be included in the support network?

    You determine who you would like to notify, and you can add as many people as you want. You invite them to be a contact, and they would download the ORA app.  

     

    How can my phone alert 911? Does it still work if I have an iPhone and it is in sleep state or locked?

    After you signal an alert, if you do not receive and answer a phone call within that 2 minutes, your Link will instruct your phone to call 911. Our patent pending system follows protocol which will unlock an iPhone in sleep state. As long as your phone is in range and charged, 911 will be called at the end of the countdown, even if your phone has a passcode and is locked.

    This is a major benefit of ORA compared to our competitors. Look closely at their messaging; it is common for them to hide in the fine print that your phone must be unlocked, or that your loved ones need to call 911. Unfortunately, that isn't optimal. Emergency services have systems to find you if you use your phone to call 911, so ORA follows how 911 emergency services actually works. ORA has also been tested with a large North American 911 provider. It works!

     

    What if I press the button accidentally?

    We've designed the Link to make it difficult to press the button by accident. The button is indented so you can feel where the button is, but makes it harder to accidentally press. However, if you do press it by accident, it's simple to cancel it: just go into the ORA app and press the ‘Cancel’ button. Your support network will be notified that you cancelled the alert. 

     

    Can I pair one ORA Link to two smartphones?

    Each ORA Link is paired to only one smartphone. If you need to, you can reconnect to a different smartphone. For more details about this, send us a message at support@oraforyou.com.

     

    What kind of notifications does the system send?

    The network receives a Push Notification in the ORA app (or a text message to a non-smartphone  phone number) and their phone will emit an emergency sound. The wearer’s ORA will vibrate aggressively, blink red and their phone will also emit an emergency sound.

     

    How I can be sure it doesn’t track my location all the time?

    Your privacy is our highest priority. ORA only tracks your location when you press the button, and shares your location information only with those contacts you have added to your support network. We respect your right to privacy and treat your personal information with strict confidentiality. 

     

    Will you ship internationally?

    ORA is currently certified for sale in Canada and the United States and is shipped from Canada. With a successful Indiegogo campaign we will seek to certify ORA in other countries. 

     

    How close does my phone need to be to ORA?

    Since the device uses Bluetooth technology, your ORA Link and phone will need to be within range (20-30 feet) of each other to ensure you can send alerts and transmit data. This range depends on your specific circumstances, like phone model and the building you are in. In general, it is best to keep your ORA and smartphone with you.

     

    What happens if my phone shuts down or loses power?

    ORA requires that the ORA app is running on your phone in order to work properly. If your phone is turned off or runs out of battery charge, your ORA will not work. 

     

    If you have any suggestions, questions or comments, we would love to hear from you!  Email us at support@oraforyou.com.

story:
Our overall project is to create a working system where as well as providing security our product also provides a charity scheme from this specific product and many more in the future to give back to the people who strive for creation

In doing so we would be able to take the stress away of funding or backing for future innovators which they need to get them to the point of raising to launch on indiegogo which we believe would create so much more mind space to be creative and imaginative, this leading to a quicker rate in the development of technology

The profits from the city smart case will be organised by us and our backers in a way which will help future waves of innovators 

To create this system the backing we receive from crowd funding will allow us to firstly create a well engineered website that we have a lot of plans for showing advertising, development of future products and the ability to buy products. It will also allow us to show the system of the circle of giving at work as the regeneration of profits takes place. The backing will allow us to order our first batch of city smart cases from our factory and be provided to you with absolute security

story:
Featured in:

Our Inspiration

We've all been there at some point in our lives - that dreadful moment of not knowing what to wear to an interview to make the best impression. A first summer job. An internship. Or our first "real" job after college.

Picking an outfit is just as important as the interview itself, because, let's face it, first impressions do matter. But the right outfit can be expensive. A professional, not see-through, white blouse can easily be $50, and a lined, fitted skirt and blouse combo can easily go over $150.

But what if you don't have a couple hundred bucks just sitting there waiting to be spent? 

Well, you're then faced with only 2 options:

  1. Buy a cheap outfit that will really only last you that one time you wear it but doesn't look as professional as you'd like it to (and can you really make the best first impression with this?)
  2. Recycle what you have (but what if you don't have anything remotely professional to start off with?)

We get it. We've both been there many times and faced the struggle. 

It is very difficult and frustrating to find something that is appropriate, that's not overly expensive, and that fits right, especially when you need it right there and then (and can't possibly sit around waiting for a miraculous sale that happens to still have the size you need in stock). 

And that is why we came up Suit & Simple, a place where you can get the outfit that you need, right when you need it - all for under $100.

We have carefully designed each piece that embodies comfort, versatility & professionalism. Plus, we have made sure to design garments that not only can be worn on the workforce, but that are versatile enough to be worn on different settings.

At the end of the day, we want to make sure you are getting the best for every cent you invest. Help us raise the funds we need to meet our minimum order requirements and place our first order!

 

We have what it takes

We come from a background of finance and fashion, and together with your help, we believe that we have what it takes to turn our vision for Suit & Simple into a reality!  Join us in our mission to make professional womenswear more affordable.

(If you want to know how the two of us met, come check out our website www.suitnsimple.com)

Milly graduated from Harvard University with a degree in Economics and Statistics. She's had many different roles in the financial industry (consulting, sales & trading, investing, and banking) - clearly suits have been an important part of her life! That's why Suit & Simple means so much to her.

Rani graduated with a degree in Fashion Management with a concentration in Fashion Design. With several fashion internships under her belt (fashion, merchandising and production internships in New York) and a full-time Technical Designer job - she clearly has the experience and knowledge required for the job!

Milly's in charge of the business operations of Suit & Simple, which includes handling the logistics, sourcing and finding the supplier, managing the expenses, building the website and many other miscellaneous behind-the-scenes jobs that need to get done (good thing she has experience working hard and long hours!). All the preparations have been done and everything is on right on track - now all that's left is to place the order items to be manufactured and shipped to you! 

Rani is in charge of all the design & technical aspects of Suit&Simple. These tasks include: from fabric selection to garment design, production management & communication to the factory, sample fitting and alterations, as well as manager of all the social media accounts (if you stop by any of them, say hi!).

How does it work?

How is it possible for us to price our suit set at a level where other retailers don't? 

Well, there are three key components:

1. We've taken it back to the basics

We've decided to produce only a single line consisting of one blouse, one blazer, and one skirt. This allows us to more effectively manage our inventory.  We are able to minimize our overhead costs because we don't have to worrying about having overstock in a style that isn't as popular and becomes dead inventory that takes up space. By going simple and back to the basics, we can more efficiently manage our capital, and this also makes it easier for us to project our inventory needs and place more accurate orders. 

But this also means that we designed our garments very carefully in order to ensure that it fits all body types. 

2. We sell directly to you

By selling directly to you, our customers, we take out the middle man from the equation. This ensures that you don't receive a product that is marked up twice! By only having an e-commerce store, we can also eliminate the added costs that come with having a brick and mortar store.

3. We care more about making suits more affordable for you than in making a profit

For us, Suit & Simple is more than just a business. It's a way for us to make a difference and empower young women by making it possible for them to dress their best and succeed. Rather than marking up our garments several times cost as is common in the fashion retail industry, we're more committed to ensuring that young women can afford the outfit they need to succeed. It's a personal mission for us.

It's taken us months to find the right manufacture, the perfect design, and the high quality fabrics that works for us - but now we're ready to launch. And we need your help to do it!

 

What You Get

Affordable. Timeless. Versatile. Our mantra.

We've carefully designed our pieces with an eye for timelessness. We wanted to create a professional-looking suit set that you can wear through the ages - 5 years from now, 10 years from now, even 50 years from now.

And we understand the 21st century you (because it's us too!). Versatility is what it's all about. So we've taken care to designed our garments to be able to work in many different settings - after work cocktails, Sunday brunch - you name it! You can dress it up, or dress it down. The possibilities are endless!

Here are Suit & Simple, we aim to do all the work for you so that all you have to worry about is nailing that interview, internship, job, conference, or presentation!

We have carefully handpicked every fabric and notion to guarantee a quality and durable garment. Each garment was created to be timeless, versatile and affordable.

               

The Simple Blouse

Made of 100% Cotton, this blouse was designed with classic elements such as the stand collar, button placket, cuffs and fit darts (on the bust area). It gives the wearer a nice silhouette without being tight. It's breathable, comfortable and professional. As a bonus, it feels as soft as baby clothes!

              

The Simple Skirt

Made of a poly-cotton blend, this skirt was designed to give its wearer a nice silhouette without being too constricting. With our special chosen fabric, we ensure that the skirt will not loose its shape throughout the day or after every wash. Plus, it's fully lined with an anti-static lining that will prevent it from shifting around uncomfortably throughout the day.

              

The Simple Blazer

Made of a poly-cotton blend, this blazer is designed with a tailored fit and flare silhouette. The wearer is guaranteed comfort and a flattering fit. It's equipped with classic elements such as the notched lapel, collar, buttons, and functional flap pockets, and plus it is also fully lined. This blazer is not only breathable enough to wear during the summer, but versatile enough to layer for the winter.

Risks & Challenges

Challenge 1: Minimum Order

We have a minimum order hurdle that we need to reach in order to have our manufacturer product the blouse, skirt, and blazer. That's why we're reaching out for all of your help and support! If we successfully raise the funds we need to place the minimum order, Suit & Simple will officially be in business!

Challenge 2: Manufacturing and shipping

We have developed a good relationship with our manufacturer and have been promised a manufacturing time of ~a month for the order. There could be unforeseen delays in manufacturing that would be out of our control.  Similarly, we've been told that shipping will take ~2 weeks, but there is always the possibility of unforeseen delays. Therefore, to stick to the safe side, we have allocated 2.5 months from the end of the campaign to when you will receive your rewards! Shipping is open to the U.S & Canada only.

Sizing

We have carefully designed each and every garment to have the best fit. For our customers' convenience we have created a measurement chart for our three garments to help you determine which size will fit you the best. We currently offer sizes: Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large.

***Each and every backer that picks up any perk with our garments will receive an email once the campaign is over to determine which size will be sent to you.***


 

 

 

Stretching Our Goals

If we raise over $20,000, we will expand our mini collection with more colors and prints. Exited to see that, help us by donating!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word!

Share our campaign with friends and family!

Like our Facebook page 

Follow us on Instagram 

Visit our website and join our launch list to stay up to date on our progress!
story_txt:
Featured in:

Our Inspiration
We've all been there at some point in our lives - that dreadful moment of not knowing what to wear to an interview to make the best impression. A first summer job. An internship. Or our first "real" job after college.
Picking an outfit is just as important as the interview itself, because, let's face it, first impressions do matter. But the right outfit can be expensive. A professional, not see-through, white blouse can easily be $50, and a lined, fitted skirt and blouse combo can easily go over $150.
But what if you don't have a couple hundred bucks just sitting there waiting to be spent? 
Well, you're then faced with only 2 options:

Buy a cheap outfit that will really only last you that one time you wear it but doesn't look as professional as you'd like it to (and can you really make the best first impression with this?)
Recycle what you have (but what if you don't have anything remotely professional to start off with?)

We get it. We've both been there many times and faced the struggle. 
It is very difficult and frustrating to find something that is appropriate, that's not overly expensive, and that fits right, especially when you need it right there and then (and can't possibly sit around waiting for a miraculous sale that happens to still have the size you need in stock). 
And that is why we came up Suit & Simple, a place where you can get the outfit that you need, right when you need it - all for under $100.
We have carefully designed each piece that embodies comfort, versatility & professionalism. Plus, we have made sure to design garments that not only can be worn on the workforce, but that are versatile enough to be worn on different settings.
At the end of the day, we want to make sure you are getting the best for every cent you invest. Help us raise the funds we need to meet our minimum order requirements and place our first order!
 
We have what it takes
We come from a background of finance and fashion, and together with your help, we believe that we have what it takes to turn our vision for Suit & Simple into a reality!  Join us in our mission to make professional womenswear more affordable.
(If you want to know how the two of us met, come check out our website www.suitnsimple.com)
Milly graduated from Harvard University with a degree in Economics and Statistics. She's had many different roles in the financial industry (consulting, sales & trading, investing, and banking) - clearly suits have been an important part of her life! That's why Suit & Simple means so much to her.
Rani graduated with a degree in Fashion Management with a concentration in Fashion Design. With several fashion internships under her belt (fashion, merchandising and production internships in New York) and a full-time Technical Designer job - she clearly has the experience and knowledge required for the job!
Milly's in charge of the business operations of Suit & Simple, which includes handling the logistics, sourcing and finding the supplier, managing the expenses, building the website and many other miscellaneous behind-the-scenes jobs that need to get done (good thing she has experience working hard and long hours!). All the preparations have been done and everything is on right on track - now all that's left is to place the order items to be manufactured and shipped to you! 
Rani is in charge of all the design & technical aspects of Suit&Simple. These tasks include: from fabric selection to garment design, production management & communication to the factory, sample fitting and alterations, as well as manager of all the social media accounts (if you stop by any of them, say hi!).
How does it work?
How is it possible for us to price our suit set at a level where other retailers don't? 
Well, there are three key components:
1. We've taken it back to the basics
We've decided to produce only a single line consisting of one blouse, one blazer, and one skirt. This allows us to more effectively manage our inventory.  We are able to minimize our overhead costs because we don't have to worrying about having overstock in a style that isn't as popular and becomes dead inventory that takes up space. By going simple and back to the basics, we can more efficiently manage our capital, and this also makes it easier for us to project our inventory needs and place more accurate orders. 
But this also means that we designed our garments very carefully in order to ensure that it fits all body types. 
2. We sell directly to you
By selling directly to you, our customers, we take out the middle man from the equation. This ensures that you don't receive a product that is marked up twice! By only having an e-commerce store, we can also eliminate the added costs that come with having a brick and mortar store.
3. We care more about making suits more affordable for you than in making a profit
For us, Suit & Simple is more than just a business. It's a way for us to make a difference and empower young women by making it possible for them to dress their best and succeed. Rather than marking up our garments several times cost as is common in the fashion retail industry, we're more committed to ensuring that young women can afford the outfit they need to succeed. It's a personal mission for us.
It's taken us months to find the right manufacture, the perfect design, and the high quality fabrics that works for us - but now we're ready to launch. And we need your help to do it!
 

What You Get
Affordable. Timeless. Versatile. Our mantra.
We've carefully designed our pieces with an eye for timelessness. We wanted to create a professional-looking suit set that you can wear through the ages - 5 years from now, 10 years from now, even 50 years from now.
And we understand the 21st century you (because it's us too!). Versatility is what it's all about. So we've taken care to designed our garments to be able to work in many different settings - after work cocktails, Sunday brunch - you name it! You can dress it up, or dress it down. The possibilities are endless!
Here are Suit & Simple, we aim to do all the work for you so that all you have to worry about is nailing that interview, internship, job, conference, or presentation!
We have carefully handpicked every fabric and notion to guarantee a quality and durable garment. Each garment was created to be timeless, versatile and affordable.
               
The Simple Blouse
Made of 100% Cotton, this blouse was designed with classic elements such as the stand collar, button placket, cuffs and fit darts (on the bust area). It gives the wearer a nice silhouette without being tight. It's breathable, comfortable and professional. As a bonus, it feels as soft as baby clothes!
              
The Simple Skirt
Made of a poly-cotton blend, this skirt was designed to give its wearer a nice silhouette without being too constricting. With our special chosen fabric, we ensure that the skirt will not loose its shape throughout the day or after every wash. Plus, it's fully lined with an anti-static lining that will prevent it from shifting around uncomfortably throughout the day.
              
The Simple Blazer
Made of a poly-cotton blend, this blazer is designed with a tailored fit and flare silhouette. The wearer is guaranteed comfort and a flattering fit. It's equipped with classic elements such as the notched lapel, collar, buttons, and functional flap pockets, and plus it is also fully lined. This blazer is not only breathable enough to wear during the summer, but versatile enough to layer for the winter.

Risks & Challenges
Challenge 1: Minimum Order
We have a minimum order hurdle that we need to reach in order to have our manufacturer product the blouse, skirt, and blazer. That's why we're reaching out for all of your help and support! If we successfully raise the funds we need to place the minimum order, Suit & Simple will officially be in business!
Challenge 2: Manufacturing and shipping
We have developed a good relationship with our manufacturer and have been promised a manufacturing time of ~a month for the order. There could be unforeseen delays in manufacturing that would be out of our control.  Similarly, we've been told that shipping will take ~2 weeks, but there is always the possibility of unforeseen delays. Therefore, to stick to the safe side, we have allocated 2.5 months from the end of the campaign to when you will receive your rewards! Shipping is open to the U.S & Canada only.
Sizing
We have carefully designed each and every garment to have the best fit. For our customers' convenience we have created a measurement chart for our three garments to help you determine which size will fit you the best. We currently offer sizes: Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large.
***Each and every backer that picks up any perk with our garments will receive an email once the campaign is over to determine which size will be sent to you.***
 

 

 
Stretching Our Goals
If we raise over $20,000, we will expand our mini collection with more colors and prints. Exited to see that, help us by donating!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us spread the word!
Share our campaign with friends and family!
Like our Facebook page 
Follow us on Instagram 
Visit our website and join our launch list to stay up to date on our progress!

story:
Indiegogo is introducing the 'Guardian X 2' 'GX2' for short. A comfortable active ware shirt. Made of spandex, polyester, and cotton featuring anti-microbial and moisture whicking technologies. You'll enjoy having fun mixing, function, versatility, and customization in a way we feel no hooded shirt has done before. 

Like many startups and innovations... it all starts with an 'idea' some are fleeting some not so fleeting, you shrug them off whimsically, but then there are the ideas that linger. They grab a hold of you in a way that's consuming. They even haunt your dreams begging for the chance to be made real. The 'GX2' is that idea! This flagship design is the first of many for the brand and company that we are creating with the help of Indiegogo and the community.


Why the hoodie? The history of the hood is a long one dating back to the early 1200's. It gives an aura of mystery and a sense of purpose to its wearer, at the same time providing protection from the elements. This is what makes the hoodie the perfect blend for my design. It's the designs simplicity that makes it appealing to both male and female wearers. 

The idea actually started way back in the 90's without my knowing it. In my little league and high school football days my brother and I we would turn our under shirts into half shirts or sometimes cutting our sleeves off. With the forgiveness from our mom of course. We did this as an adolescent attempt to show off our athletic physique impressing our teammates and the cheerleaders. This highlighted the fruits of all our practice and hard work. Seemingly there was actually a functional component about doing this that we didn't fully understand. We were able to move better our bodies were able stay cooler and frankly it just looked cool. As the years progressed I would see other kids doing the same thing my brother and I did all those years prior. It got me thinking... being that we are visual in nature as human beings. We like to show off our hard work in gyms or out in public. So why not create something that anyone can wear regardless of body type and size that would do just that. Something that motivates and at the same time builds confidence. This was the birth of the GX2 guardian times 2. Two pieces, a long sleeved shirt and a drawstring hood that can be attached and detached at will to suit the wearers’ style or use.

This leaves you with one final question. "How will you wear your guardian"?






                                                                  LOGO



                                         Ancient Martial Arts Exercise Manual


Here you have an exercise manual that is good for learning the basics of finding or developing your Chi within you.
        

This campaign will provide the necessary capital to fund our first production, website design & launch, patent & trademarking which is already filed with the USPTO.gov, Patent/Application # 14169141. 

Note: Video and pictures depict prototype samples. Final product will meet manufacturers QA standards. Sizes to choose from will be XL L M while quantities last. For a tighter fit choose one size down.

    Risks & Challenges

    The possible challenges will depend upon sizing and ensuring our customers select the right size.

    We have a very good relationship with our factory that we have been working with for over a year now on samples and design. That being said, we can't be naive as there are sometimes risks with shipping and timing for production orders. We will be completely open and available if there are any delays in shipping due to manufacturing delays after project completion.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Ask friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
    • Remind, no tell them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Don't be shy we need your support to get this new brand out there!!

story:
If you have an idea and you want to make something by your own or bring your idea , your kids idea , your friends idea to life and you need the tool to support it and if you need CNC machine with affordable price , high performance and heavy duty  so then why don't build it by your own if you can build it.


Sample Screenshot of iD2CNC Machine


Machine (2ft x 4ft) Explode view



Machine (2ft x 4ft)


Machine (4ft x 2ft)



Machine (4ft x 4ft)





Why build CNC by your own?


- Affordable price.
- Learn and know about CNC Build.
- Use this knowledge to teach your kids , your friends about how to build CNC.
- You can customize it (If you get 3D sketchup or customize it base on information of this plan).

 

What you will got from iD2CNC Plan v.2.1?


(Reward $20) Standard Plans Contents  ::
– B.O.M (Machine 2ft x 4ft) with estimate cost.
– B.O.M (Machine 4ft x 2ft) with estimate cost.
– B.O.M (Machine 4ft x 4ft) with estimate cost.
– Machine explode views & part detail document (include 2'x2',4'x2',4'x4').
– Reference parts detail document.
– Assembly guide document.
– Assembly guide video.
– Electronic wiring diagram.
– Mach3 config guide.
– Mach3 Auto Zero tool guide.
– Aluminum 2D (DXF Files).

(Reward $89) Standard 3D Plans Contents  ::
– 3D Google sketchup machine 2ft x 4ft , 4ft x 4ft.
– B.O.M (Machine 2ft x 4ft) with estimate cost.
– B.O.M (Machine 4ft x 2ft) with estimate cost.
– B.O.M (Machine 4ft x 4ft) with estimate cost.
– Machine explode views & part detail document (include 2'x2',4'x2',4'x4').
– Reference parts detail document.
– Assembly guide document.
– Assembly guide video.
– Electronic wiring diagram.
– Mach3 config guide.
– Mach3 Auto Zero tool guide.
– Aluminum 2D (DXF Files).
– Aluminum 2D (Google Sketchup Files).

(Reward $119) Pro 3D Plans Contents ::
– 3D Google sketchup machine 2ft x 4ft , 4ft x 2ft , 4ft x 4ft.
– 3D Google sketchup machine explode 2ft x 4ft , 4ft x 2ft , 4ft x 4ft.
– B.O.M (Machine 2ft x 4ft) with estimate cost.
– B.O.M (Machine 4ft x 2ft) with estimate cost.
– B.O.M (Machine 4ft x 4ft) with estimate cost.
– Machine explode views & part detail document (include 2'x2',4'x2',4'x4').
– Reference parts detail document.
– Assembly guide document.
– Assembly guide video.
– Electronic wiring diagram.
– Mach3 config guide.
– Mach3 Auto Zero tool guide.
– Aluminum 2D (DXF Files).
– Aluminum 2D (Google Sketchup Files).


CNC Machine spec ::


iD2CNC Machine v.2.1 Specification (2ft x 4ft) ::
– Machine working area 650mm x 1250mm x 150mm (width x length x height).
– Machine size 1000mm x 1600mm x 700mm (width x length x height).
– Design using metric unit (mm).
– Dual motor and ball screw on Y Axis.
– 16mm Ball screw & rod rail .

iD2CNC Machine v.2.1 Specification (4ft x 2ft) ::
– Machine working area 1250mm x 650mm x 150mm (width x length x height).
– Machine size 1600mm x 1000mm x 700mm (width x length x height).
– Design using metric unit (mm).
– Dual motor and ball screw on Y Axis.
– 16mm Ball screw & rod rail .

iD2CNC Machine v.2.1 Specification (4ft x 4ft) ::
– Machine working area 1250mm x 1250mm  x 150mm (width x length x height).
– Machine size 1600mm x 1600mm x 700mm (width x length x height).
– Design using metric unit (mm).
– Dual motor and ball screw on Y Axis.
– 16mm Ball screw & rod rail .

 

How much cost to build it?


- For 2'x4' by using wood router , estimate cost about $1,600.
- For 4'x2' by using wood router , estimate cost about $1,600. 
- For 4'x4' by using wood router , estimate cost about $1,800. 

- For 2'x4' by using 1.5kw water cooled spindle , estimate cost about $1,900.
- For 4'x2' by using 1.5kw water cooled spindle , estimate cost about $1,900.
- For 4'x4' by using 1.5kw water cooled spindle , estimate cost about $2,100.


Some screenshot of documents ::



What tool you need to build CNC machine?


If you have some basic tools at your house then you almost have every necessary tools (see some sample tools that  i used to build CNC).

Note :: If you have better precision and accuracy tools like milling machine ,it would be better.


Where you can find some sample or build log to guide you how to build it?


You can see detail of build log from my blog there have a lot of picture.    
My blog--> iD2CNC.com
 

See all detail build log at my blog here --> iD2CNC.com


Sample work piece ::


How to using CNC ::

There are 3 workflows to using CNC. (CAD --> CAM --> G-Code)
- Use CAD program or vector drawing program.
- Use CAM program to convert your CAD or vector to G-Code
- Run G-Code in CNC (Load G-Code to CNC Control software like Mach3)


Frequently Asked Questions ::


Q :: What's material the machine can cut?
A :: Soft metal , aluminium , wood , plastic , acrylic.

Q :: Do your plan design by using inch/mm ?
A :: It's design by using millimeter.

Q :: Can this plan convert to 4ft x 8ft?
A :: It can convert to 4ft x 8ft but if you tuning motor to run fast then it will have some issued on 8ft base , the ball screw will twisting and it will make the machine lose step and will damage your work peice  , for 8ft base it should be rack & pinion.

Q :: Why does it have a few video of the machine on your blog?
A :: Because after finished build the machine not for long i need to did medical treatment to cure neuroinflammation then i need to sold it to get money to support my treatment.

Q :: Where to buy the parts for build CNC?
A :: You need to find it from your local supplier or if you can't find it then go eBay.

Q :: What's different between iD2CNC v.2.0 on your blog and iD2CNC v.2.1?
A :: iD2CNC v.2.1 design base on v.2.0 but improve and solve some issued that v.2.0 have.

Q :: Can this plan covert to Plasma CNC?
A :: Yes , you can convert it to Plasma CNC by remove center base aluminium profile and change table top to support plasma and add/or change spindle clamp to plasma clamp  but it don't have detail how to convert it in this plan , you do it at your own risk.

story:
KIDS SHOULD NOT HAVE TO BE BRAVE TO WEAR CLOTHES THEY LIKE!

SUIT HER will offer hip, unique, ready-to-wear suits for girls age five to twelve that are full of fun detail and made to fit a girl's body. They will be high-quality suits with hand-picked fabrics and lots of attention to detail and fit. Finally! Girls will be able to choose a suit made just for them.


( Check out my appearance on CNN's HLN talking about SUIT HER!)

Our initial collection will offer three different looks: The General She (casual), The Classic She (semi-formal), and The She-She (formal). Each jacket can be paired with a bottom of choice (pants, shorts, or skirt). This provides several styles to accommodate a girl's personal taste in a variety of circumstances, from casual to dressy. Below are the specific designs for each suit in the collection:

The She-She is exactly as it sounds...a high-end look for any formal occasion. Wear it with a skirt, pants, or shorts depending on the event. The bright red buttons and satin details will blow everyone away!

The Classic She is that classic suit look, but with unique details like burlap elbow patches and dark purple satin trim around the pockets. This look is strikingly fashion-forward with our crisp, white button-down shirt and tie of choice. (Tie pictured is a dinosaur silkscreen pattern by Cyberoptix Tie Lab.)

The General She is a fun take on the military look, featuring army green cotton twill fabric, gold metallic buttons, and a star on the back of the jacket. Also included are several detachable epaulets for added color and flair.

In addition, we will also offer ties to go along with the Classic Suit option. Our ties are colorful and fun!

Our Team: Fashion Designer & Manufacturer  

Karen Patwa - PFZ's fashion designer

I have hired fashion designer Karen Patwa, who KNOWS suits because she's been custom creating them for women for years. You can see some of her work on her website Dangerous Mathematicians. Her background in physics is not only cool, but also mission-aligned with the PFZ brand and SUIT HER's stereotype-busting approach to girls' apparel. She has already drawn up these amazing designs which will be turned into the prototypes.

Julie Hutton - Owner/Manufacturer Julie Hutton, Inc. 
For manufacturing needs, I'll be working with the woman-owned manufacturing company Julie Hutton, Inc., based in New York City. Julie has been in the business for twenty years and her "Personal Label" division specifically helps the budding designer navigate the process of clothing design from beginning to end, ensuring a successful result. Her company uses six different factories right in Manhattan. To that end, I am happy to say that once we go into production all of our products will be made in the USA.

Where will the funds go?

With your help, the majority of the funds raised will go toward the actual prototypes for all pieces for each suit which is the first step in the process. This includes full designs, fabrics/materials, patterns and sewing of the three different suit option which include a jacket and three bottoms. We will use a standard model to fit the prototype and ensure proper sizing. The remainder will go toward marketing, website and photography costs.

Funding for SUIT HER

In addition, if we surpass our goal we hope to put it toward the actual manufacturing of the suits as well as marketing/advertising and updating our website.

Initially, the suits will retail for approximately $149 which includes a jacket and bottom of choice. The suits will be made to last--with high quality materials and details. All products will be manufactured here in the United States.

Timeline

Once the campaign has ended, it will take approximately five months to get from sketches/designs to final prototypes. There are many steps in between to finalize details and make sure the suits will be everything we want them to be. I will maintain communication as to the timeline and what is happening at every step along the way. Our focus is on a high-quality product with attention to detail. We will offer pre-ordering/sales as soon as we have samples and sizing in hand.  Manufacturing the initial run will take approximately six months:

Timeline

Phase I

  • Aug - Sept: launch SUIT HER 30 day campaign
  • Sept 2016 - Jan 2017: five months to produce physical prototypes/samples of suits 
  • Jan 2017: update campaign with photos and samples of suits
Phase II
  • Jan - June 2017: begin to take orders and go into full production and manufacturing
  • June/July 2017 - ship orders

It is no small endeavor to produce and manufacture three unique suits with different pieces which is why I am doing this project in phases. I want to be sure I can accomplish each phase thoroughly and with attention to the details that will make these suits special.

**Please note that if we raise beyond our goal and begin production of suits earlier, we will shorten this timeline.**

Back in 2010, when she was five, she wanted to wear a tuxedo to her violin recital. She always loved ties - especially bow ties. From a very young age she wanted a tuxedo. She would say, "Mom, I want a tornado!" [sic] We searched and searched and couldn't find one for girls...so we bought her a boy's tux. She wore it proudly with her black and white Jordan high-top sneaks and her (then) long hair pulled back in a ponytail. Since then, she has opted to wear suits for many occasions.

My girl at five in a tux and Jordan high tops!

In 2008, I found myself unemployed due to layoffs during the recession. I decided to pursue my passion for providing non-stereotyped clothing and toy options for girls like my daughter, so I sold my wedding ring to get started and created the Princess Free Zone brand, blog and website. I knew that my daughter could not be the only girl who preferred non-princess, non-pink, non-glittery clothing, but rather race cars, building toys, and super heroes. And come to find out - I was right.

My goal has always been to create a clothing line for girls that offers ALL girls more choice in how they express themselves. After all, if they're not seeing alternatives to princess and pink, they can't choose something different; and many do not even consider going to boys' aisles or departments. And why should they have to? 

Princess Free Zone has been producing fun, hip t-shirts for girls since 2009, including designs like a dinosaur riding a scooter, an octopus with a mustache, and a crab made of tools. In addition, we've introduced a line of gender-equal tees featuring the phrase "SHOW YOUR COOL" for both girls and boys.

I also wrote and published a children's book called "Super TooLula: The Kind Warrior" which features a young phenom named Lula who has her own tool belt and helps her dad with carpentry projects. She uses her super hero gifts and magical tools to protect and come to the aid of kids who are mistreated or bullied. 

Through my website, blog, and social media, I have learned that there are countless girls who aren't being recognized or respected in the mostly pink-and-princess departments. Behind them are supportive parents and relatives looking for more choices, who don't want their girls limited by what big companies decide is for girls. I've worked hard for six years not only to provide alternatives for kids, but to build community and engage in a conversation around gender identity and stereotypes so that I could be a part of the change I wanted for my daughter and, ultimately, all girls.

Recently PFZ was featured on The Huffington Post as one of "12 Brilliant Kids' Clothing Lines That Say No To Gender Stereotypes." I've also been a guest on CNN's HLN speaking to princess culture and how girls particularly are bombarded with messages that deplete their self-esteem, body image and confidence. I was an invited speaker at Emory University's Health and Humanitarian Summit where I discussed the insidious and harmful nature of gender stereotypes and gendered marketing, particularly on children.

What is the long term goal?

We are starting with SUIT HER to be able to get the concept from designs to physical prototypes. Once we go into production, our intention is to offer more fabulous suit designs (like a fabulous red suit and even a patterned suit) and eventually a full clothing line. 

ALL GIRLS ARE NOT THE SAME--AND WE WOULDN'T WANT THEM TO BE!

If you want to be part of expanding options for girls so that they know that being a girl means being whoever they want to be; if you want to be a part of real change when it comes to gender stereotypes--then JOIN US. I have put my heart and soul into Princess Free Zone and wholeheartedly believe that SUIT HER is a game changer. It's going to be an exciting journey and I hope you'll join me.

story:
A lack of options

Co-founder Nora started surfing again last year and discovered surf wear didn't exist above a size XL, and those XLs were few and far between and anything but flattering. An avid yoga practitioner, she also lamented she had limited options in yoga leggings, despite being the most common size in the USA.  Asking around for suggestions among her like-sized friends, she quickly found there weren't a lot of options. Baggy sweatpants for yoga and male board-shorts for surfing slipped off or pinched in the wrong areas. 

On a surf trip to Costa Rica, the idea for 124 West was born.

By helping fund 124 West, you are helping women have access to athletic wear they can feel good in. Your contribution will help us get our first production run out as well as expand our offerings so women, no matter what their size, can feel comfortable in what they're wearing. Yoga and surfing are for all bodies, and we want to show the world that.

 

What's available in the first production run?

There are 5 items available in the first run, all available in XXS-4X:

1. Scylla - our reversible multiple-use top. Scylla is solid colored on one side and a print on the other. Scylla ties in the back, can be twisted if you need a tighter fit, and on many bodies can be pulled up or down over the hips instead of overhead. Scylla works well as a cropped top for yoga class and as a swim top for catching waves or just chilling by the pool.

2. Charybdis - our high-waist swim bottom. Charybdis has a high waist band that won't slip when swimming or surfing, ruching to hide anything you want hidden, and can be folded down if you want more skin to show.

 

 

3. Medusa - our rash guard. Don't let your skin turn to stone- Medusa features thumb holes to protect the back of your hands from the sun as well as a subtle sweetheart neckline.

 

 

4. Ceto - our full length leggings. A warning- Ceto was designed with a 5'11" friend in mind as well as friends who like to pull their leggings over their heels, so you will find our leggings are longer than what's offered on the market now. Ceto conveniently has a pocket on the right side that is large enough to hold a phone and/or wallet

5. Echidna- our cropped leggings on those 5'5" and taller, but regular length on anyone shorter. Echidna is a cropped version of her mother Ceto, and both are designed to be worn to yoga class and then into the ocean to catch some waves.

 

 

These items are available in the following prints: (L-R) Don't Stop Be-Leafing, All the Right Angles, Saturnailed-It, Gotcha Covered.

They're also available in solid colors (R-L): Ebony Darkness (Black), Hello Sailor (Navy Blue), Seattle Sunshine (Gray), and Nicoya (Sky Blue)

 

All of these items are made from the same recycled material, offer UPF 50 sun protection, can be worn for either land or water activities, are chlorine-resistant, and are machine washable. Because ain't nobody got time for hand-washing.

 

Where does funding go? What perks are available?

The funding we need today will go toward our first production run and expansion of our offerings. This includes fabric purchases, fabric printing, manufacturing, compostable-bags to hold product, boxes for shipping, marketing expenses, new design tech packs and samples, grading to expand size offerings, and any other odds and ends. Manufacturing items using only recycled goods and making them in the United States is costly, but your funding goes toward an eco-conscious and ethical choice as full USA manufacturing cuts out any chance of child labor or sweatshop production.

Our perks range from a hemp friendship bracelet as a thank you, to parts of our first line, all the way up to naming a design or print and/or coming with us on a photo-shoot next year.

In the event we don't reach our goal, we will still go to production and anyone who has funded us, will get what they ordered. A lack of funding simply means cutting back on expanding our offerings.

Where we are in this journey

We have just returned from a week in Costa Rica with our group of 124 West Warriors sizes XS-2X gathering fit information. The last week of November 124 West will be working onsite with our manufacturing team making all the changes we discovered we needed to make. This means we will begin our first production run the first or second week of December, with delivery expected at the end of January.

 

Why is what 124 West is offering so important?

Fact: More than half of the women in the United States are a size 14 or higher.

Despite this, there are very few options for flattering and attractive athletic-wear for women size 14 or higher. This is a 1/4th of the market in the USA, but it is ignored. In an age where we are constantly barraged by what 'ideal beauty' is, anyone outside of that range is given clothing options to hide themselves instead of express themselves. 124 West wants everyone to feel beautiful and comfortable whether they're running a marathon or marathoning their favorite tv show. 

Plus, our leggings have pockets!

Furthermore, 124 West is dedicated to giving back, and part of our future profits will go toward cleaning the ocean. Clean waters are important to us, and the fabric we have chosen is made from ghost nets found in the ocean. With your help, 124 West seeks to better the oceans through educational campaigns and funding organizations helping protect our marine environments. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money doesn't grow from trees, otherwise we wouldn't have asked for help. We understand if you're light on funds, but there are other ways you can help us. By sharing the link for this campaign on your social media accounts or with friends and family, you'll be spreading the word for us, which is invaluable <3 

 

 

 

Catch a wave with us at:

www.124west.com

Facebook

Instagram

story:
Bringing "fresh" back into your closet

As a man, I never understood the problem of not having the right clothes at the right time until this past year. Pam, my girlfriend of six years, was staring intently at her closet (which was full of clothes bought within the last year) with a shake of the head or a "No, that won't work" every few seconds. Meanwhile, I was lying on her bed in my khaki pants and a classy J. Crew sky blue, button-up shirt, waiting for her to get dressed so we could go out. I watched from her bed for almost fifteen minutes as her anxiety turned to despair when I realized that I could probably help her. It went like this:

Me: "Babe, what's the matter?" 

Pam: "Oh, nothing, it's just that I have so many clothes but it feels like I don't have any."

Me: "Why not?"

Pam: "I've just worn these clothes so many times that I feel like I need something fresh that I could wear just for this weekend."
Me: "Well what if there was a way to get you just that - a new dress for the weekend and you just return it in prepackaged envelope when you're done? Sort of like Netflix when they first started."
Pam: "That would be perfect!"
The concept stuck. We soon found out about Rent the Runway and a few subscription clothing companies that do similar rentals, but what we really needed was a dress that you could rent that wasn't too expensive, boasted high quality and stole peoples' gaze. But most importantly, since it's only a rental we wanted to let our customers know that it's not the end of the world when the entire club spills their drinks on you, because, well, you could just return it and not worry about it. Or if you really liked it (and you're one of the lucky few who stayed dry...) you could buy it at a preset clearance price. 

The sooner we get started... 

... the sooner you'll have access to some of the hottest clubbing dresses out there. We can bring this project to life in 45 days, but to do that, we need your help. I've enlisted Pam's help and my dad's help to help us make this the coolest clothing rental company on the face of the planet. 
This company is about you, the club-goer, who wants a new look whenever you go out. We need funding to get started. Every dollar counts. Every Facebook like counts. Every share counts. The chances of reaching our goal are only greater when you helped us succeed and that's an important thing to keep in mind down the road. 

How you can get involved:

  • We need to know what you like so that we can buy the right gear.  Take a few minutes to check out and leave some feedback at our rating site: www.FashionClubWare.com (That's sort of like a pun on "Ware"-house and "wear" clothes. Get it?) We are posting 100 dresses at a time and getting feedback on what the most popular looks are right now.
  • How many of you have ever thought about modeling as a career? We need beta models, testers, brand ambassadors and people who don't mind getting their hands dirty. Our inventory is from all around the world, and we need to figure out what works on American club goers.  We need models in our beta test to say what's awesome and what's not. Email us at fabulousclubwear@gmail.com for more information.
  • How would you like to get a discount for sharing this page on Instagram or in a Facebook status? There's a $5 in-store credit if you tag us to your post!
We have six levels of participation -
  • A dollar donation to help us grow
  • One discounted outfit rental at $19.00 (normally $24.99)
  • Two outfit rentals for the price of one at $24.99 (normally $44.00)
  • Three outfit rentals at $35.00 (normally $66.00)
  • VIP treatment - four outfit rentals and keep your favorite one $99.00 (Valued at $250!)
  • Bottle Service - Receive one free rental/month, keep your favorite, 10% off all future rentals for life. All of this for only $249 (A $450 value!)

Let's make an impact

At FabulousClubWear, it's all about making you feel beautiful and comfortable in the clothes you're wearing. Here are the benefits of using us in a nutshell:

  • Try something that you would never buy.
  • Go out this weekend because you have something awesome to wear.
  • Don't be afraid to go hard since the dress is only a rental.
  • 100% money back guarantee on all future rentals. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is doing nothing and staying home.  We're going to make FabulousClubWear happen, and its going to be bigger with your help!  If you have something Fabulous to wear, you can't stay home this weekend.

Developer Backgrounds

Marshall Masterson is a recent college grad trying to do what every other millennial in the world wants: make an impact. Currently working at a venture-backed startup in California, his business experience spans across commercial real estate and private equity. It also includes doing consulting on hot-rodded Porsches, big data consulting for a retail store, radio DJ-ing and otherwise taking the less-travelled route (in life and in traffic). 

Thomas Masterson is a serial entrepreneur.  His first two companies... a computer telephone answering service and an environmental services company went nowhere.  His third company, International Medical Publishing, Inc. had a 15 year run and was one of the top medical publishing companies in the United States.  IMP sold over two million copies of the Day by Day Diabetes Calendar.  IMP created the first and #1 website for dialysis patients - DialysisFinder.com, which was sold to Davita. Dr. Masterson is the executive director of the American Association of Hospitalist Directors (AAOHD.org) and is a partner in LostMyRx.com and LeadFollowers.com.  He is an avid clubgoer and looks forward to making you look fabulous!

Pam's background is coming soon!
story_txt:
Bringing "fresh" back into your closet
As a man, I never understood the problem of not having the right clothes at the right time until this past year. Pam, my girlfriend of six years, was staring intently at her closet (which was full of clothes bought within the last year) with a shake of the head or a "No, that won't work" every few seconds. Meanwhile, I was lying on her bed in my khaki pants and a classy J. Crew sky blue, button-up shirt, waiting for her to get dressed so we could go out. story:
Are You Making These Shoes Even If You Don't Get Funded?

Yes. In fact we have already begun mass production (see pics in our first update), so don't be afraid to support our campaign!

When will these be ready to ship?

Approximate shipping date is Feb 27th 2015.

What sizes and styles do they come in? How do I know what size to get? 

We currently have four styles for both the shoes and the baby booties:

If you need help figuring out what shoe size to get, download and print our free sizing chart.

How do I choose my sizes and characters?

Production is going better than expected, so we are planing on beginning to ship out perks to backers even before our campaign ends. We will post an update soon on how you can pick your sizes and characters. 

Otherwise we'll send you to a form where you can choose the sizes and characters you want once the campaign has ended.



Most adults totally take walking for granted. Talking to one of them you’d think that walking was the easiest thing in the world. Well, it’s a different story for toddlers. In fact, learning to walk can be downright scary. At ikiki, we don’t think walking should be scary, it should be fun.

Virtually all kid shoes are just adult shoes, only smaller. But kids' feet are different than adult feet, so the shoes should be different too. That’s why we started from the ground up to reimagine kids’ shoes. We’ve searched long and hard to find the best materials for a breathable, comfortable, and fun shoe for kids that will help them learn to walk.



Other than the comfortable feel and kid-focused design, what really sets ikiki shoes apart is our patent-pending adjustable squeaker in the sole of each shoe. Not only will your little one get a kick out of the fun noise, squeaking shoes have been recommended by physical therapists and pediatricians to help kids learn to walk and reinforce good walking habits. 


There are other squeaker shoes out there, but you can’t turn off the squeaker without taking the whole thing out which, to us, seemed like a choking hazard waiting to happen. That’s why we made a squeaker that can be turned on or off with the flip of a switch.

Our fun and innovative squeaker makes ikiki shoes perfect for crawlers learning to walk, kids learning to take proper heel-to-toe steps, or anyone who wants walking to be exciting.

And with four charming animal characters, and more on the way, these shoes are more like a wearable toy than just a shoe. Finally, a shoe that kids won’t want to take off!


“…my daughter is walking SO much more confidently, and she jumped last week. She has always been scared to even try. She’s increased her speed, flexibility, and confidence by 3000%. It’s a different kid! That squeak is so much more than knowing where my daughter is, or a cute little attention getter . . . it’s peace of mind . . . you guys have changed our lives!”

-Stormy G.


“I love the squeaky shoes for when we go out, not only for the cute look but also because I always hear where my daughter is.”

-Emma Rain


“I no longer have to battle getting shoes on my son’s feet! The first day he wore his new ikiki shoes he wouldn’t let me take them off. He even took his nap with his new Narwhal friends . . . I also like having the versatility of turning the squeak on and off so easily and not losing the noisemaker. I love these shoes!”

-Trish O.



We wanted ikiki shoes to be more than just another pair of shoes or booties, and you and your child will get that feeling the moment the box arrives. The box is made from earth friendly, recyclable materials and you’ll be able to open it without needing to grab knives or scissors. Inside the box you’ll not only find your ikiki friends, but you’ll also have a colorfully designed insert that will tell you more about the character and the animal that character was based on.

This extra level of detail not only makes ikiki a great product for parents, it’s also a great gift idea. ikiki booties are a great gift for baby showers and both the shoes and the booties are an excellent gift to give to nieces and nephews. 



If you love the ikiki friends but your little one isn't big enough to need shoes yet, don't worry, we have all of the ikiki characters available in booties as well as in shoes. The booties don't squeak, but they are made from super soft material that caresses your baby's feet. And the strong, but gentle elastic around the ankle guarantees that the booties will stay on, even during play time. 



Learning to walk is tough, or so I've heard... As a sea dweller I haven't really had a chance to try my flipper at it (Man, maybe I'm not a good shoe spokescritter after all). If I was a land mammal like you though, I'd want a pair of ikiki squeaky shoes. You can't beat shoes that double as fun friends to hang out with all day! I'd never take them off!



Squeaking everywhere you go can be more fun than a ball of yarn, but there are times when all that squeaking isn't helpful. I have a feeling mice everywhere would rest a little easier if I squeaked everywhere I went. Fortunately, ikiki shoes have the purrrfect solution: a special squeaker that turns on and off with the flip of a switch!



I love humans and baby humans and smelling things and toys! Oh yes, I love toys! Especially ones with squeakers! ikiki shoes have built-in squeakers that make every step a ball! And when you have a ball you can throw it and I can catch it and then you can throw it again and I can catch it again over and over. Squeakers aren't just fun though. When you squeak with every step, it's easier to keep on stepping!



As a spider, I know all about sneaking. It's pretty much how I put food on the table for hundreds of my own babies. While they've got nothin' on spiders, human kids are pretty good at sneaking around too. You humans have it pretty good though: one pair of squeaky shoes and you can track even the stealthiest of tots. I need FOUR pairs PER KID!! Minimum.


Preston Wily Founder and Lead Manufacturing Director

Preston originally came up with the idea for ikiki shoes in 2009 when looking for great shoes for his own kids. He and Cameron have been working on toddler shoes ever since. ikiki shoes are their second successful squeaky shoe design. 

Cameron Postelwait Founder and Lead Marketing Director

Cameron has been working with Preston for years. With one toddler shoe design already made and several successful crowd funding campaigns already under his belt, Cameron is more than ready to make ikiki shoes a reality.

Drew Cordova Lead Creative Director and Graphic Designer

A lifelong animal lover, audio engineer, DIY electronics tinkerer, and graphic designer, Drew channels a wide range of influences in his work on the ikiki design team. Two of his best friends are four legged mammals of the feline and pot-bellied-porcine variety (Miss Kitty and Minnie respectively).



How do I choose my sizes and characters?

Production is going better than expected, so we are planing on beginning to ship out perks to backers even before our campaign ends. We will post an update soon on how you can pick your sizes and characters. 

Otherwise we'll send you to a form where you can choose the sizes and characters you want once the campaign has ended.

What are you going to do with the money you raise?

We have our designs finished, prototypes made, and have a deal with a great manufacturer. The only thing we’re missing is the funding to start mass production. That’s where you come in. The money raised in this campaign will pay for our initial tooling costs, which allows us to get ikiki shoes to as many kids as possible.

When do my kids get their shoes?

We’ll be able to ship your ikiki shoes to you within weeks of the end of our campaign, hopefully sooner. We've been making different squeaky shoes for a while now and have all of the kinks worked out in the production process so we can get these shoes on your child’s feet as soon as possible.

What sizes do they come in? How do I know what size to get?

ikiki shoes are currently offered in U.S. sizes 3-11. If you need help figuring out what size to get, download and print our free sizing chart.

What if ikiki shoes are too big for my child?

Not to worry! We  sell all the same characters as booties as well as shoes. Just look for the booties in the funding options.

How can I possibly pick one character over another?

That’s a common dilemma. The easiest solution…why try? Your child is bound to love all of the ikiki friends, and as an early supporter of our campaign you can get the kind of discounts that make it easy to get them all.

Do ikiki shoes really give my child super powers?

We've heard these rumors, but we haven’t been able to verify them yet. But ikiki shoes really do help your child walk better. In fact, squeaking shoes have been recommended by physical therapists and pediatricians to help toddlers learn to walk.
