story:
After our successful crowdfunding campaign, we are now glad to be on Indiegogo In-demand to offer pre-sales. Watches are currently in production and delivery will start according to our planning (see further below).

If you don't know yet our story: At Wolbrook, we are here to share and continue with you an adventure that started more than 70 years ago! Hear us out!

Maximilien - Mission Commander, Wolbrook Watches

 

THE CAMPAIGN IS NOW CLOSED.

SEE YOU ON OUR WEBSITE: www.wolbrook.com

CONTACT US / NOUS CONTACTER : https://www.facebook.com/wolbrook or / ou https://www.instagram.com/wolbrook

 

A. WOLBROOK ORIGINS

In 1949, WOLBROOK watches and its sister brand DOUGLAS watches were born. Their most distinguished timepiece was a special tool-watch from the 1960s, nicknamed the SKINDIVER “WORLDTIMER” by collectors. With advertising in Life, Time, and Esquire magazines, these “incredible” watches – as they were called in the headlines - were renowned for their water resistance and were in fact sold in a water-filled container. 

Esquire Advertising June and July 1974 - Note: $19.95 USD would be around $350 to $450 in 2020, if you consider factors like currency appreciation, increased costs of labor and raw material.

Then the “Quartz Crisis” in the 1970s happened…

B. A UNIQUE TOOL-WATCH FROM THE 1960s

A DOUGLAS Skindiver “Worldtimer” from the 1960s, owned and worn by a legendary test pilot, astronaut and engineer was recently auctioned and its authenticity was confirmed (Source: Heritage Auction). This tool-watch was worn by engineers and test pilots.

 

A 1960s Skindiver tool-watch was recently auctioned and its authenticity was confirmed

The 1960s Skindiver “Worldtimer” was a solid, water-resistant and highly legible timepiece with luminous markers and hands, large sweep second hand, distinctive hour and minute hands, time zone, elapsed time and 24 hours indicators. This mix of features from a diving watch and a pilot watch makes it the kind of tool-watch “a NASA engineer and test pilot” would personally choose and wear.

A test pilot flies countless aircrafts through his career. The fact that his Skindiver could accompany him in a cockpit is highly probable but which one is impossible to know and leaves a part of mystery. This is where history stops and the legend starts…

C. WOLBROOK & DOUGLAS: THE TWO SISTER BRANDS

WOLBROOK and DOUGLAS brands were two sister brands birthed in the 1940’s. To be more accurate WOLBROOK was the "mother" brand and DOUGLAS was the "daughter" brand, as inside DOUGLAS watches the movements and parts were signed WOLBROOK. This practice was common, with other renowned watch brands in the 1960s, where cases, movements and parts were shared among sister brands.

Vintage Douglas and Wolbrook from the 1960s

Under WOLBROOK brand, DOUGLAS watches will embody the professional line; with key features like Hesalite glasses. DOUGLAS timepieces  (the "Skindiver WT Pro" during this campaign) will use essential colors for bezels and dials while WOLBROOK ones  (the "Skindiver WT Auto" and the "Skindiver WT Mecaquartz" during this campaign) will use more flamboyant combinations. Once more the dials will be signed Douglas while the other components will be signed WOLBROOK.

With your help our mission is to bring back the Skindiver "Worldtimer" and Wolbrook as an independent watchmaker and a viable company to offer continuous support for yesterday's watches and to develop the ones of tomorrow's.

D. THEY MENTIONED US

 

Check our watches on:

  • Fratello - Hands-on review:  Wolbrook Skindiver “Worldtimer”  & This Week in Watches: November 30, 2019 
  • Les Rhabilleurs - Hands-on review (in French):  Douglas Skindiver Worldtimer Professional 
  • Worn & Wound:  Bringing Back the Wolbrook Skindiver WT 
  • Le Figaro (In French):  "Douglas, la plus Française des Américaines" 
  • The Wrist Watch Review - Hands-on review: To space and the sea with Douglas Skindiver WT Automatic 
  • Scottish Watches:  Half Watchtuesday Week 28 & Half Watch Tuesday Week 27 
  • As seen in British GQ of May:

Skindiver WT Auto with beads of rice bracelet

 

After being asleep for 50 years, WOLBROOK is being resurrected in France and once again these “incredible” SKINDIVER watches will be assembled there. To lead the way and to commemorate and celebrate mankind’s incredible achievements, with the X-15 and the Apollo 11 programs, the Skindiver “Worldtimer” is re-edited in 3 versions:

See the details and other color combinations further below.

 A. SKINDIVER WT PROFESSIONAL - X-15 EDITION

 1. The X-15: The NASA Ultimate Hyper-sonic Rocket-Powered Aircraft

At the premises of the space race, before men looked up to the Moon, the first frontier was outer space. In 1960, to carry on aerodynamic researches, NASA engineers defined the requirements for an ultimate plane: a hypersonic rocket-powered aircraft capable of near space flight. The X-15 program was born.

The X-15: The NASA Ultimate Hypersonic Rocket-Powered Aircraft. Here attached to a B-52 Mothership. PHOTO CREDIT: NASA

From 1959 to 1968, through 199 flights reaching the maximum altitude of 107.8 km (67.0 mi) and the top speed of 6,206 km/h (3,856 mph) the NASA X-15 planes laid the ground work for spacecraft navigation. The 12 test pilots from the program were from the US Air Force and NASA, among these audacious and highly skilled pioneers where the man who would set the first foot on the Moon in 1969.

The Skindiver WT Professional tool-watch X-15 Edition celebrates this incredible plane by featuring an engraving of the X-15 aircraft on its caseback, the iconic aeronautical industry line: “The proof is in the flying”.

2. Skindiver WT Professional – Specs

 With an Hesalite glass, 5 color combinations and an automatic Citizen / Miyota movement, this version is the most faithful reedition for the watch passionate and space conquest fan. Like all professional line watches from WOLBROOK, these models boast DOUGLAS logo on the dial. We use three layers of pure C7 Super-LumiNova Lume which is the best solution without killing the daytime look.

The Skindiver WT Pro is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces.

 3.  Skindiver WT Professional Combos

Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.

4. FOCUS ON: Hesalite, The Space Glass

While the WOLBROOK watches are fitted with scratch-proof sapphire crystals, the DOUGLAS - Skindiver WT Pro - models are equipped with an Hesalite glass. While the harder and more resistant to scratches sapphire crystal is a great choice for everyday adventures on earth, Hesalite glass has critical properties for space explorers.

The Skindiver WT Pro is equipped with an Hesalite glass

Starting with the Apollo program, NASA selected and provided watches to its astronauts that were sporting Hesalite glasses. Why? Hesalite has high impact resistance and does not shatter as glass does. In zero gravity, the possibility of having tiny bits of glass floating around in the cabin was considered an unnecessary risk for the crews and their spaceships heading to the Moon.

5. FOCUS ON: Miyota 8215 Automatic Movement

In-house modified Miyota 8215 with a “roulette” style date disk and a solid movement holder

The in-house modification of the Miyota 8215 with a “roulette” style date disk – red for even days and black for odd ones on white background – and a setting of the 8215 at a tolerance of ±15 seconds per day (against -20/+40 when delivered by Miyota) are concrete examples of the uncompromising willingness to do things properly from what can be seen to what is barely observable.

Why choose the Miyota 8215? We selected the 8215 as it's an acclaimed work-horse movement and a consistent choice with the tool-watch spirit we want to achieve while making sense on the industrial side: secured access for us (lead time and quantities) and can be modified in-house easily with a custom date disk "roulette" style and later on could be turned into a hand-wound only, etc... Higher specs movements would have increased the price, added availability risks or make the adventure a one-shot which is incompatible with our goal to bring back Wolbrook watches as a viable company.

6. Skindiver WT Professional on the Wrist

Wrist size on the picture is 18.5cm. The straps presented are optional.

 B. SKINDIVER WT AUTOMATIC

1. Celebrate The Moon Landing of 1969

While walking on the Moon was quite something, successfully and manually land (on the Moon) the Lunar Module baptized Eagle was one of mankind's greatest achievements. PHOTO CREDIT: NASA

On the SKINDIVER WT AUTOMATIC watch APOLLO 11 EDITION, we celebrate and honor this endeavor with a case-back engraving of the Lunar Module “Eagle” in the landing configuration with both ascent and descent stages.

2. Skindiver WT Automatic – Specs

With a sapphire glass box crystal, 12 color combinations and an automatic Citizen / Miyota movement, this version is the modern reedition for the everyday gentleman. On the dials using white and vintages indexes, three layers of BGW9 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied. On the dials using green indexes, three layers of pure C7 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied which is the best solution without killing the daytime look.

Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces.

 3. Skindiver WT Automatic Combos

Each Skindiver is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.

Each Skindiver is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.

4.  FOCUS ON: Double Dome Sapphire Crystal

Double dome sapphire with outer cyclops lens above the date and inner anti-reflective coating

The Skindiver WT Automatic is fitted with a double-domed scratch-proof sapphire crystal with an outer cyclops lens above the date window and inside anti-reflective coating. This is the very best of watchmaking in terms of sapphire crystals.

5. Skindiver WT Auto on the Wrist

Wrist size on the picture is 18.5cm. Some of the straps presented are optional.

C. SKINDIVER WT MECAQUARTZ

1. Celebrate the 1st Moon Take-Off

On the SKINDIVER WT MECAQUARTZ wrist-watch APOLLO 11 EDITION, we celebrate and pay tribute to the successful take-off from the Moon with a case-back engraving of the Lunar Module “Eagle” in the taking-off configuration with the ascent stage only.

2. Skindiver WT Mecaquartz – Specs

With a flat sapphire crystal, 6 color combinations and a sweep second Mecaquartz movement from Seiko, this version is the present-day interpretation for the daily adventurer.  On the dials using white and vintages indexes, three layers of BGW9 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied. On the dials using green indexes, three layers of pure C7 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied which is the best solution without killing the daytime look.

Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces

3. SKINDIVER WT MECAQUARTZ COMBOS 

Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.

4. FOCUS ON: Seiko VH31 Mecaquartz Movement

The Seiko VH31 movement is a quartz movement with a sweeping central second hand moving in 1/4 of second increments which is similar to the one of a mechanical movement. The result? The best of both worlds: a watch with a sweeping second hand that won't stop for at least 2 years (Approximately 2 years of battery life). 

Seiko VH31 - "Mecaquartz" movement, a quartz movement with a sweeping second hand

5. Skindiver WT Mecaquartz on the Wrist

Wrist size on the picture is 18.5cm.

6. FOCUS ON: Assembled in France

WOLBROOK and DOUGLAS watches were originally assembled in France and Switzerland. With the recent rebirth of the centuries-old French watch industry and proven industrial viability, it made total sense for WOLBROOK watches to be made once more in France. All the Skindiver watches presented as reward in this campaign will be assembled in France.

With assembly in France, Wolbrook goes back to its original roots

7. FOCUS ON: The Straps and Bracelets

All Wolbrook leather straps are using Italian and vegetable-tanned leather, meaning no chemicals were used in their processing. The best and right choice for your skin and our environment. On the launch of the campaign the following straps and bracelets are available:

a. One-piece 20mm nylon with leather parts

Extra Nylon Strap with leather parts: Add 29€ / ~32$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.

Wolbrook nylon & leather one-piece watch strap is inspired by U.S. Military specifications and is available in black and army green with brown leather. Delivered in standard with the Skindiver WT Pro and the Skindiver WT Mecaquartz. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked! Add 29€ / ~32$ to get it as an additional strap.

b. One-piece 20mm vegetable-tanned Italian leather 

Extra One-Piece Leather Strap: Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.

These one-piece leather watch strap is inspired by U.S. Military specifications and comes in black, brown, or camel colors. Delivered in standard with the Skindiver WT Automatic. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal, and it's now unlocked!  Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge get it as an additional strap.

IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: As these are made of vegetable-tanned Italian leather, they are now planned for the 1st week of June.

c. Two-Piece 20-16mm Vegetable Tanned Italian Leather Strap

Extra Two-Pieces Leather Strap: Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.

With hand stitching in black, brown or camel colors. Optional and compatible with all the Skindivers. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked! Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge get it as an additional strap.

IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: As these are made of vegetable tanned Italian leather, they are now planned for the 1st week of June.

d. “American” / Pilot Plate

Extra Bund Plate: Add 19€ / ~21$ to your pledge to get it as an additional item.

Made of vegetable-tanned Italian leather, in black, brown or camel colors. Optional and compatible with all straps. Delivered in standard with the Skindiver WT Pro. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked!

IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: As these are made of vegetable tanned Italian leather, they are now planned for the 1st week of June.

e. 20mm Mesh Band

Extra Mesh Band: Add 49€ / ~54$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.

Optional and compatible with all the Skindivers. 316L Stainless Steel. The mesh is a stretch goal and will be available if we reach the funding level of 50K€.  UPDATE: We reached the 50K€ funding level and thus these bands are available! Extra Mesh Band: Add 49€ / ~54$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.

f. Beads of Rice Solid Band

Extra Beads of Rice Bracelet / Solid Band: Add 89€ / ~99$ to your pledge to get it as an additional bracelet.

The beads of rice bracelet is compatible with all the Skindivers tool-watches. 20-16mm width, 316L Stainless Steel, Riveted solid links and end-links, double lock deployant clasp with 5 micro-adjustment positions, and easy-bar system for quick strap change. 

IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: Unlike the watches, the beads of rice bracelet is more impacted in terms of delays. The extra development needed for this custom bracelet was slowed down by the Covid-19 situation, these are now planned for the end of June.

Extra Beads of Rice Bracelet/ Solid Band: Add 89€ / ~99$ to your pledge to get it as an additional bracelet.

IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.04.28: The beads of rice bracelet is now available in black PVD.

Extra Black PVD Beads of Rice Bracelet / Solid Band: Add 99€ / ~109$ to your pledge to get it as an additional bracelet.

Pre-production beads of rice bracelets on pre-production watch cases

g. Stretch Goal - "Tropic" Style Rubber Straps

Extra Rubber Strap: Add 69€ / ~77$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.

Made of genuine natural rubber and inspired by the classic rubber Tropic strap from the 1960s in 20-16mm. Optional and compatible with all the Skindivers. Update: The black rubber strap was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked! Add 69€ / ~77$ to your pledge get it as an additional strap.

IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: The extra development needed for this custom strap has been slowed down, these are now planned for the end of June.

8. FOCUS ON: The Travel Pouch

 All the Skindiver Watches will be delivered with a travel pouch made of canvas and vegetable-tanned leather. Included with the purchase of any Skindiver.

 D. REWARDS SUM-UP & SPECIAL PACKS

*Every watch includes the strap presented in chapter "III. THE RETURN OF THE SKINDIVERS". For logistic reasons, this strap is by default. If you would like another strap, you need to add it to your pledge.

A. Watch Rolls

Wolbrook 4 slots watch roll is available in camel, blue and green canvas with brown vegetable-tanned leather. It can fit watches of 43mm diameter and smaller. Like our watches, it is closed by our signature buckle. 

Camel Watch Roll - Add 39€ to your pledge

Camel Watch Roll - Add 39€ to your pledge

Camel Watch Roll - Add 39€ to your pledge

B. Wolbrook Swiss Knife

Available with the Pack 5 is the Wolbrook customized Swiss knife. (Not available separately or outside of this pack).

Some straps or combo options require extra-costs for tooling and molding that are financially too heavy unless we reach certain funding levels or ordered quantities defined by the Stretch Goals. 

Thanks to our backers, we have been able to unlock these extra options for straps and watch combos as follow:

PHOTO CREDIT: NASA

We are watch industry veterans who are sharing a common passion for timepieces. With key in-house skills like design, engineering, components procurement and of course watchmaking, we have the know-how, the industrial solutions, the structure and the resources essential to craft quality timepieces and critical to the success of such enterprise. The team is composed of:

Maximilien - The passionate brain behind the rebirth and relaunch of Wolbrook and the guy with a French accent on the video and 8 years experience in the watch industry. He loves vintage watches - mostly mechanical but as occasional crush on quartz -, burgers, and cats but not mixed together. He hates the watch designs that make no sense. 

Elva - Aka the "Big Chef" - She has 14 years of watchmaking experience and knows how to industrialize a watch concept like magic. With contacts in Switzerland, France, and China, she makes things happen anywhere, anytime. She loves lady timepieces from the 1960s. She hates cactus.

Daniel & Kenneth - Daniel learned design from Sir Dyson himself and takes care of the art direction while Kenneth, his magical side-kick, makes sure all design details work out. Kenneth's magical powers extend to photos and videos. Have you checked our Instagram?

Sean - Our engineer. Experienced. Smart. When you asked "Can we have a Hesalite glass box?" he answers "With inner or outer cyclops?". He likes molecular cooking.

Jessie & Amélie - In the trenches, they make sure the components suppliers deliver the expected quality on-time. They can spot a quality defect on a sapphire crystal like owls spot mice in pitch black from 50m. They love cheese fondue. 

"Mouss" -  Our head watchmaker taking care of the assembly of the watches with his team of watchmakers. He engineers watch movements in his spare-time.

Louis - Engineer and self-taught geek. He is our digital wizard. Words he hacked NSA on a lunch break once. Loves Serrano ham. Hates bad code.

Marion - Our admin person. On the ground, she battles with the French administration to get the company up and running. She likes Thai salads with Chicken meatballs. She hates when the chicken meatballs are forgotten in her salad.

Wolbrook & Douglas - Our two adopted stray cats. A mother and her daughter...

A. GENERAL PLANNING

UPDATED ON 2020.05.09:

With more than 30 years watch manufacturing experience shared in the team (with direct Kickstarter or Indiegogo experience on helping brands on that particular side), we were confident we could meet the deadlines of our "Flight Plan" further below and start to ship the watches from France by the end of May 2020 as follow:

  1. May 15th, 2020 - Skindiver WT Mecaquartz 
  2. June 15th, 2020 - Skindiver WT Automatic
  3. July 15th, 2020 - Skindiver WT Professional

In between, the Covid-19 happened! While we planned for the usual production issues, we could not predict that one. This unprecedented situation has cost us most of our time margin.

With France getting slowly out of the confinement period and a slower / more complicated logistic than usual, we had to re-organize and consolidate the assembly schedule and take into account the delays of the leather raw parts, “beads of rice” bracelets and rubber straps, we re-organized it as below:

  1. June 20th 2020 - Skindiver WT Mecaquartz & Skindiver WT Automatic (both without beads of rice bracelet or rubber strap)
  2. July 10th 2020 - Skindiver WT Mecaquartz & Skindiver WT Automatic (both with beads of rice bracelet or rubber strap)
  3. July 25th 2020 - Skindiver WT Professional

As you can see, the Skindiver WT Mecaquartz are pushed back while the Skindiver WT Automatic are a little bit back on track (for these without “beads of rice” bracelets and rubber straps. We also expect the Skindiver WT Professional to be back closer to the original planning.

Please be noted, that the situation linked to the Covid-19 is evolving day by day and extra delays might happen when we get to the assembly stage in France – where the virus is getting momentum - by the end of April / early May.

Note: Why are the Skindiver WT Automatic and the Skindiver WT Professional planned later? 

The Skindivers WT Automatic are planned later because their double-domed sapphire with cyclops lens needs more time to be crafted. The Skindivers WT Professional needs extra time to have their water resistance increased from 6ATM (like originally planned - that's why you may see 6ATM in previous communication) to 10ATM (as our engineer and Hesalite manufacturer found the way to make it happen). The case and Hesalite need to be re-engineered and thus we need to make new tooling and moldings which require an extra month.

All and all, good things take time, especially quality watchmaking, and we can assure you our Skindiver worth the little extra waiting. These days, we all tend to forget the pleasure of waiting for something great.

 

B. PRODUCTION STATUS OF THE WATCHES

Currently, the components of the watches are in production. We have received the hands and the dials.

Dials drying up after the layering of the Super-LumiNova.

Production run dials and hands with C7 and BGW9 Super-LumiNova pigments on the testing bench. Check!

Second hands

Minute hands - Day time and night time

Broad arrow hour hands with vintage lum

We need your help to spread the word about our pre-sales and bring back Wolbrook and the Skindiver “Worldtimer”!

Share one of our post or a story on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/wolbrook/), on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/wolbrook/), the link to the Indiegogo pre-sales page (Short link: https://igg.me/at/wolbrook-mechanical-automatic...) or a radio message. Take a screenshot and once the campaign is over, share it with us by email and we will add a watch tool to your pledge (value 10€)! Easy!

 

A. SHIPPING & WARRANTY

Worldwide shipping is included in our pricing. Please be aware that you are responsible for duties, fees, and taxes applicable in your country.

Our watches are delivered with a 3-year warranty that covers the repair of any material or manufacturing defects. 

B. DISCLAIMER

As mentioned in Wolbrook's story: a Skindiver “Worldtimer” model was owned and worn by a famous test pilot and engineer.  His Skindiver tool-watch was recently auctioned and his brother confirmed its authenticity.

As we have no certainty, we are not making any statement on any specific mission or plane. Our special editions are humbly paying tribute to outstanding mankind's achievments. We are sticking to the facts: this Skindiver "saw action" and by the look of it - wear and tears, faded marking on the bezel, along with a replacement military specs nylon strap - it did not stay in a  drawer. As many test pilot, astronaut or regular man through the 1960s and the 1970s owning a personal, extra or back-up watch on top of your standard issued watch was common sense and practice (Source: Hodinkee)

C. Environmental commitments

Long-lasting design

These watches can last a lifetime and more as long as they are: 1. Properly revised and maintained by a qualified watchmaker every 5 years. 2. Used in a normal way, for instance, they can't be used as a nutcracker.

Reusability and recyclability

All watches are delivered with a pouch made of canvas and vegetable-tanned leather. All our packagings are using recycled cartons and can be recycled themselves. We choose not to use a traditional box that would be wasteful and costly for our environment. We also worked on the size to ensure efficient shipping and "low cost" for the environment.

Sustainable materials

We selected stainless steel as a base material for the watches. For now, we can not guarantee 100% the impact of the mining and transformation but at least all the metals used in our watches can be recycled. For our straps, we selected vegetable-tanned leathers that are less impactful on our environment than traditional leather that is tanned with chromium. For the nylon straps, we are using recycled nylon. For our packaging, all our watches will be delivered in a travel pouch made of eco-friendly canvas and vegetable-tanned leather, wrapped in a recycled carton.

Environmentally friendly factories

While we are strong believers that the watch industry as a long way to go, for our components, we choose factories with proper waste management. As seen, above we also tried to select the best raw material too. As a new player, we will try our best to move the status quo and environmentally friendly solutions will always our favor.

Sustainable Distribution

We will try to have two to three shipping hubs to rationalize shipping: Europe, North America and Asia. We will update our backers on that point when we are ready to ship.

Something else

We believe all these are baby steps but they are at the very core of our values and we will try our upmost to enforce them. One small step...
story_txt:
After our successful crowdfunding campaign, we are now glad to be on Indiegogo In-demand to offer pre-sales. Watches are currently in production and delivery will start according to our planning (see further below).If you don't know yet our story: At Wolbrook, we are here to share and continue with you an adventure that started more than 70 years ago! Hear us out!Maximilien - Mission Commander, Wolbrook Watches THE CAMPAIGN IS NOW CLOSED.SEE YOU ON OUR WEBSITE: www.wolbrook.comCONTACT US / NOUS CONTACTER : https://www.facebook.com/wolbrook or / ou https://www.instagram.com/wolbrook A. WOLBROOK ORIGINSIn 1949, WOLBROOK watches and its sister brand DOUGLAS watches were born. Their most distinguished timepiece was a special tool-watch from the 1960s, nicknamed the SKINDIVER “WORLDTIMER” by collectors. With advertising in Life, Time, and Esquire magazines, these “incredible” watches – as they were called in the headlines - were renowned for their water resistance and were in fact sold in a water-filled container. Esquire Advertising June and July 1974 - Note: $19.95 USD would be around $350 to $450 in 2020, if you consider factors like currency appreciation, increased costs of labor and raw material.Then the “Quartz Crisis” in the 1970s happened…B. A UNIQUE TOOL-WATCH FROM THE 1960sA DOUGLAS Skindiver “Worldtimer” from the 1960s, owned and worn by a legendary test pilot, astronaut and engineer was recently auctioned and its authenticity was confirmed (Source: Heritage Auction). This tool-watch was worn by engineers and test pilots. A 1960s Skindiver tool-watch was recently auctioned and its authenticity was confirmedThe 1960s Skindiver “Worldtimer” was a solid, water-resistant and highly legible timepiece with luminous markers and hands, large sweep second hand, distinctive hour and minute hands, time zone, elapsed time and 24 hours indicators. This mix of features from a diving watch and a pilot watch makes it the kind of tool-watch “a NASA engineer and test pilot” would personally choose and wear.A test pilot flies countless aircrafts through his career. The fact that his Skindiver could accompany him in a cockpit is highly probable but which one is impossible to know and leaves a part of mystery. This is where history stops and the legend starts…C. WOLBROOK & DOUGLAS: THE TWO SISTER BRANDSWOLBROOK and DOUGLAS brands were two sister brands birthed in the 1940’s. To be more accurate WOLBROOK was the "mother" brand and DOUGLAS was the "daughter" brand, as inside DOUGLAS watches the movements and parts were signed WOLBROOK. This practice was common, with other renowned watch brands in the 1960s, where cases, movements and parts were shared among sister brands.Vintage Douglas and Wolbrook from the 1960sUnder WOLBROOK brand, DOUGLAS watches will embody the professional line; with key features like Hesalite glasses. DOUGLAS timepieces  (the "Skindiver WT Pro" during this campaign) will use essential colors for bezels and dials while WOLBROOK ones  (the "Skindiver WT Auto" and the "Skindiver WT Mecaquartz" during this campaign) will use more flamboyant combinations. Once more the dials will be signed Douglas while the other components will be signed WOLBROOK.With your help our mission is to bring back the Skindiver "Worldtimer" and Wolbrook as an independent watchmaker and a viable company to offer continuous support for yesterday's watches and to develop the ones of tomorrow's.D. THEY MENTIONED US Check our watches on:

Fratello - Hands-on review:  Wolbrook Skindiver “Worldtimer”  & This Week in Watches: November 30, 2019 


Les Rhabilleurs - Hands-on review (in French):  Douglas Skindiver Worldtimer Professional 


Worn & Wound:  Bringing Back the Wolbrook Skindiver WT 


Le Figaro (In French):  "Douglas, la plus Française des Américaines" 


The Wrist Watch Review - Hands-on review: To space and the sea with Douglas Skindiver WT Automatic 


Scottish Watches:  Half Watchtuesday Week 28 & Half Watch Tuesday Week 27 
As seen in British GQ of May:
Skindiver WT Auto with beads of rice bracelet After being asleep for 50 years, WOLBROOK is being resurrected in France and once again these “incredible” SKINDIVER watches will be assembled there. To lead the way and to commemorate and celebrate mankind’s incredible achievements, with the X-15 and the Apollo 11 programs, the Skindiver “Worldtimer” is re-edited in 3 versions:See the details and other color combinations further below. A. SKINDIVER WT PROFESSIONAL - X-15 EDITION 1. The X-15: The NASA Ultimate Hyper-sonic Rocket-Powered AircraftAt the premises of the space race, before men looked up to the Moon, the first frontier was outer space. In 1960, to carry on aerodynamic researches, NASA engineers defined the requirements for an ultimate plane: a hypersonic rocket-powered aircraft capable of near space flight. The X-15 program was born.The X-15: The NASA Ultimate Hypersonic Rocket-Powered Aircraft. Here attached to a B-52 Mothership. PHOTO CREDIT: NASAFrom 1959 to 1968, through 199 flights reaching the maximum altitude of 107.8 km (67.0 mi) and the top speed of 6,206 km/h (3,856 mph) the NASA X-15 planes laid the ground work for spacecraft navigation. The 12 test pilots from the program were from the US Air Force and NASA, among these audacious and highly skilled pioneers where the man who would set the first foot on the Moon in 1969.The Skindiver WT Professional tool-watch X-15 Edition celebrates this incredible plane by featuring an engraving of the X-15 aircraft on its caseback, the iconic aeronautical industry line: “The proof is in the flying”.2. Skindiver WT Professional – Specs With an Hesalite glass, 5 color combinations and an automatic Citizen / Miyota movement, this version is the most faithful reedition for the watch passionate and space conquest fan. Like all professional line watches from WOLBROOK, these models boast DOUGLAS logo on the dial. We use three layers of pure C7 Super-LumiNova Lume which is the best solution without killing the daytime look.The Skindiver WT Pro is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. 3.  Skindiver WT Professional CombosEach Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.4. FOCUS ON: Hesalite, The Space GlassWhile the WOLBROOK watches are fitted with scratch-proof sapphire crystals, the DOUGLAS - Skindiver WT Pro - models are equipped with an Hesalite glass. While the harder and more resistant to scratches sapphire crystal is a great choice for everyday adventures on earth, Hesalite glass has critical properties for space explorers.The Skindiver WT Pro is equipped with an Hesalite glassStarting with the Apollo program, NASA selected and provided watches to its astronauts that were sporting Hesalite glasses. Why? Hesalite has high impact resistance and does not shatter as glass does. In zero gravity, the possibility of having tiny bits of glass floating around in the cabin was considered an unnecessary risk for the crews and their spaceships heading to the Moon.5. FOCUS ON: Miyota 8215 Automatic MovementIn-house modified Miyota 8215 with a “roulette” style date disk and a solid movement holderThe in-house modification of the Miyota 8215 with a “roulette” style date disk – red for even days and black for odd ones on white background – and a setting of the 8215 at a tolerance of ±15 seconds per day (against -20/+40 when delivered by Miyota) are concrete examples of the uncompromising willingness to do things properly from what can be seen to what is barely observable.Why choose the Miyota 8215? We selected the 8215 as it's an acclaimed work-horse movement and a consistent choice with the tool-watch spirit we want to achieve while making sense on the industrial side: secured access for us (lead time and quantities) and can be modified in-house easily with a custom date disk "roulette" style and later on could be turned into a hand-wound only, etc... Higher specs movements would have increased the price, added availability risks or make the adventure a one-shot which is incompatible with our goal to bring back Wolbrook watches as a viable company.6. Skindiver WT Professional on the WristWrist size on the picture is 18.5cm. The straps presented are optional. B. SKINDIVER WT AUTOMATIC1. Celebrate The Moon Landing of 1969While walking on the Moon was quite something, successfully and manually land (on the Moon) the Lunar Module baptized Eagle was one of mankind's greatest achievements. PHOTO CREDIT: NASAOn the SKINDIVER WT AUTOMATIC watch APOLLO 11 EDITION, we celebrate and honor this endeavor with a case-back engraving of the Lunar Module “Eagle” in the landing configuration with both ascent and descent stages.2. Skindiver WT Automatic – SpecsWith a sapphire glass box crystal, 12 color combinations and an automatic Citizen / Miyota movement, this version is the modern reedition for the everyday gentleman. On the dials using white and vintages indexes, three layers of BGW9 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied. On the dials using green indexes, three layers of pure C7 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied which is the best solution without killing the daytime look.Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. 3. Skindiver WT Automatic CombosEach Skindiver is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.Each Skindiver is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.4.  FOCUS ON: Double Dome Sapphire CrystalDouble dome sapphire with outer cyclops lens above the date and inner anti-reflective coatingThe Skindiver WT Automatic is fitted with a double-domed scratch-proof sapphire crystal with an outer cyclops lens above the date window and inside anti-reflective coating. This is the very best of watchmaking in terms of sapphire crystals.5. Skindiver WT Auto on the WristWrist size on the picture is 18.5cm. Some of the straps presented are optional.C. SKINDIVER WT MECAQUARTZ1. Celebrate the 1st Moon Take-OffOn the SKINDIVER WT MECAQUARTZ wrist-watch APOLLO 11 EDITION, we celebrate and pay tribute to the successful take-off from the Moon with a case-back engraving of the Lunar Module “Eagle” in the taking-off configuration with the ascent stage only.2. Skindiver WT Mecaquartz – SpecsWith a flat sapphire crystal, 6 color combinations and a sweep second Mecaquartz movement from Seiko, this version is the present-day interpretation for the daily adventurer.  On the dials using white and vintages indexes, three layers of BGW9 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied. On the dials using green indexes, three layers of pure C7 Super-LumiNova Lume are applied which is the best solution without killing the daytime look.Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces3. SKINDIVER WT MECAQUARTZ COMBOS Each Combo is numbered and limited to 1969 pieces. The watch and bracelet combos are fixed. As it's too heavy logistic wise, the watch comes with the strap presented above by default. If you wish another bracelet, it is possible to add an additional one.4. FOCUS ON: Seiko VH31 Mecaquartz MovementThe Seiko VH31 movement is a quartz movement with a sweeping central second hand moving in 1/4 of second increments which is similar to the one of a mechanical movement. The result? The best of both worlds: a watch with a sweeping second hand that won't stop for at least 2 years (Approximately 2 years of battery life). Seiko VH31 - "Mecaquartz" movement, a quartz movement with a sweeping second hand5. Skindiver WT Mecaquartz on the WristWrist size on the picture is 18.5cm.6. FOCUS ON: Assembled in FranceWOLBROOK and DOUGLAS watches were originally assembled in France and Switzerland. With the recent rebirth of the centuries-old French watch industry and proven industrial viability, it made total sense for WOLBROOK watches to be made once more in France. All the Skindiver watches presented as reward in this campaign will be assembled in France.With assembly in France, Wolbrook goes back to its original roots7. FOCUS ON: The Straps and BraceletsAll Wolbrook leather straps are using Italian and vegetable-tanned leather, meaning no chemicals were used in their processing. The best and right choice for your skin and our environment. On the launch of the campaign the following straps and bracelets are available:a. One-piece 20mm nylon with leather partsExtra Nylon Strap with leather parts: Add 29€ / ~32$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.Wolbrook nylon & leather one-piece watch strap is inspired by U.S. Military specifications and is available in black and army green with brown leather. Delivered in standard with the Skindiver WT Pro and the Skindiver WT Mecaquartz. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked! Add 29€ / ~32$ to get it as an additional strap.b. One-piece 20mm vegetable-tanned Italian leather Extra One-Piece Leather Strap: Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.These one-piece leather watch strap is inspired by U.S. Military specifications and comes in black, brown, or camel colors. Delivered in standard with the Skindiver WT Automatic. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal, and it's now unlocked!  Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge get it as an additional strap.IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: As these are made of vegetable-tanned Italian leather, they are now planned for the 1st week of June.c. Two-Piece 20-16mm Vegetable Tanned Italian Leather StrapExtra Two-Pieces Leather Strap: Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.With hand stitching in black, brown or camel colors. Optional and compatible with all the Skindivers. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked! Add 39€ / ~43$ to your pledge get it as an additional strap.IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: As these are made of vegetable tanned Italian leather, they are now planned for the 1st week of June.d. “American” / Pilot PlateExtra Bund Plate: Add 19€ / ~21$ to your pledge to get it as an additional item.Made of vegetable-tanned Italian leather, in black, brown or camel colors. Optional and compatible with all straps. Delivered in standard with the Skindiver WT Pro. Update: Dark blue color was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked!IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: As these are made of vegetable tanned Italian leather, they are now planned for the 1st week of June.e. 20mm Mesh BandExtra Mesh Band: Add 49€ / ~54$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.Optional and compatible with all the Skindivers. 316L Stainless Steel. The mesh is a stretch goal and will be available if we reach the funding level of 50K€.  UPDATE: We reached the 50K€ funding level and thus these bands are available! Extra Mesh Band: Add 49€ / ~54$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.f. Beads of Rice Solid BandExtra Beads of Rice Bracelet / Solid Band: Add 89€ / ~99$ to your pledge to get it as an additional bracelet.The beads of rice bracelet is compatible with all the Skindivers tool-watches. 20-16mm width, 316L Stainless Steel, Riveted solid links and end-links, double lock deployant clasp with 5 micro-adjustment positions, and easy-bar system for quick strap change. IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: Unlike the watches, the beads of rice bracelet is more impacted in terms of delays. The extra development needed for this custom bracelet was slowed down by the Covid-19 situation, these are now planned for the end of June.Extra Beads of Rice Bracelet/ Solid Band: Add 89€ / ~99$ to your pledge to get it as an additional bracelet.IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.04.28: The beads of rice bracelet is now available in black PVD.Extra Black PVD Beads of Rice Bracelet / Solid Band: Add 99€ / ~109$ to your pledge to get it as an additional bracelet.Pre-production beads of rice bracelets on pre-production watch casesg. Stretch Goal - "Tropic" Style Rubber StrapsExtra Rubber Strap: Add 69€ / ~77$ to your pledge to get it as an additional strap.Made of genuine natural rubber and inspired by the classic rubber Tropic strap from the 1960s in 20-16mm. Optional and compatible with all the Skindivers. Update: The black rubber strap was a stretch goal,  and it's now unlocked! Add 69€ / ~77$ to your pledge get it as an additional strap.IMPORTANT UPDATE ON 2020.03.29: The extra development needed for this custom strap has been slowed down, these are now planned for the end of June.8. FOCUS ON: The Travel Pouch All the Skindiver Watches will be delivered with a travel pouch made of canvas and vegetable-tanned leather. Included with the purchase of any Skindiver. D. REWARDS SUM-UP & SPECIAL PACKS*Every watch includes the strap presented in chapter "III. THE RETURN OF THE SKINDIVERS". For logistic reasons, this strap is by default. If you would like another strap, you need to add it to your pledge.A. Watch RollsWolbrook 4 slots watch roll is available in camel, blue and green canvas with brown vegetable-tanned leather. It can fit watches of 43mm diameter and smaller. Like our watches, it is closed by our signature buckle. Camel Watch Roll - Add 39€ to your pledgeCamel Watch Roll - Add 39€ to your pledgeCamel Watch Roll - Add 39€ to your pledgeB. Wolbrook Swiss KnifeAvailable with the Pack 5 is the Wolbrook customized Swiss knife. (Not available separately or outside of this pack).Some straps or combo options require extra-costs for tooling and molding that are financially too heavy unless we reach certain funding levels or ordered quantities defined by the Stretch Goals. Thanks to our backers, we have been able to unlock these extra options for straps and watch combos as follow:PHOTO CREDIT: NASAWe are watch industry veterans who are sharing a common passion for timepieces. With key in-house skills like design, engineering, components procurement and of course watchmaking, we have the know-how, the industrial solutions, the structure and the resources essential to craft quality timepieces and critical to the success of such enterprise. The team is composed of:Maximilien - The passionate brain behind the rebirth and relaunch of Wolbrook and the guy with a French accent on the video and 8 years experience in the watch industry. He loves vintage watches - mostly mechanical but as occasional crush on quartz -, burgers, and cats but not mixed together. He hates the watch designs that make no sense. Elva - Aka the "Big Chef" - She has 14 years of watchmaking experience and knows how to industrialize a watch concept like magic. With contacts in Switzerland, France, and China, she makes things happen anywhere, anytime. She loves lady timepieces from the 1960s. She hates cactus.Daniel & Kenneth - Daniel learned design from Sir Dyson himself and takes care of the art direction while Kenneth, his magical side-kick, makes sure all design details work out. Kenneth's magical powers extend to photos and videos. Have you checked our Instagram?Sean - Our engineer. Experienced. Smart. When you asked "Can we have a Hesalite glass box?" he answers "With inner or outer cyclops?". He likes molecular cooking.Jessie & Amélie - In the trenches, they make sure the components suppliers deliver the expected quality on-time. They can spot a quality defect on a sapphire crystal like owls spot mice in pitch black from 50m. They love cheese fondue. "Mouss" -  Our head watchmaker taking care of the assembly of the watches with his team of watchmakers. He engineers watch movements in his spare-time.Louis - Engineer and self-taught geek. He is our digital wizard. Words he hacked NSA on a lunch break once. Loves Serrano ham. Hates bad code.Marion - Our admin person. On the ground, she battles with the French administration to get the company up and running. She likes Thai salads with Chicken meatballs. She hates when the chicken meatballs are forgotten in her salad.Wolbrook & Douglas - Our two adopted stray cats. A mother and her daughter...A. GENERAL PLANNINGUPDATED ON 2020.05.09:With more than 30 years watch manufacturing experience shared in the team (with direct Kickstarter or Indiegogo experience on helping brands on that particular side), we were confident we could meet the deadlines of our "Flight Plan" further below and start to ship the watches from France by the end of May 2020 as follow:
May 15th, 2020 - Skindiver WT Mecaquartz 
June 15th, 2020 - Skindiver WT Automatic
July 15th, 2020 - Skindiver WT Professional
In between, the Covid-19 happened! While we planned for the usual production issues, we could not predict that one. This unprecedented situation has cost us most of our time margin.With France getting slowly out of the confinement period and a slower / more complicated logistic than usual, we had to re-organize and consolidate the assembly schedule and take into account the delays of the leather raw parts, “beads of rice” bracelets and rubber straps, we re-organized it as below:
June 20th 2020 - Skindiver WT Mecaquartz & Skindiver WT Automatic (both without beads of rice bracelet or rubber strap)
July 10th 2020 - Skindiver WT Mecaquartz & Skindiver WT Automatic (both with beads of rice bracelet or rubber strap)
July 25th 2020 - Skindiver WT Professional
As you can see, the Skindiver WT Mecaquartz are pushed back while the Skindiver WT Automatic are a little bit back on track (for these without “beads of rice” bracelets and rubber straps. We also expect the Skindiver WT Professional to be back closer to the original planning.Please be noted, that the situation linked to the Covid-19 is evolving day by day and extra delays might happen when we get to the assembly stage in France – where the virus is getting momentum - by the end of April / early May.Note: Why are the Skindiver WT Automatic and the Skindiver WT Professional planned later? The Skindivers WT Automatic are planned later because their double-domed sapphire with cyclops lens needs more time to be crafted. The Skindivers WT Professional needs extra time to have their water resistance increased from 6ATM (like originally planned - that's why you may see 6ATM in previous communication) to 10ATM (as our engineer and Hesalite manufacturer found the way to make it happen). The case and Hesalite need to be re-engineered and thus we need to make new tooling and moldings which require an extra month.All and all, good things take time, especially quality watchmaking, and we can assure you our Skindiver worth the little extra waiting. These days, we all tend to forget the pleasure of waiting for something great. B. PRODUCTION STATUS OF THE WATCHESCurrently, the components of the watches are in production. We have received the hands and the dials.Dials drying up after the layering of the Super-LumiNova.Production run dials and hands with C7 and BGW9 Super-LumiNova pigments on the testing bench. Check!Second handsMinute hands - Day time and night timeBroad arrow hour hands with vintage lumWe need your help to spread the word about our pre-sales and bring back Wolbrook and the Skindiver “Worldtimer”!Share one of our post or a story on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/wolbrook/), on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/wolbrook/), the link to the Indiegogo pre-sales page (Short link: https://igg.me/at/wolbrook-mechanical-automatic...) or a radio message. Take a screenshot and once the campaign is over, share it with us by email and we will add a watch tool to your pledge (value 10€)! Easy! A. SHIPPING & WARRANTYWorldwide shipping is included in our pricing. Please be aware that you are responsible for duties, fees, and taxes applicable in your country.Our watches are delivered with a 3-year warranty that covers the repair of any material or manufacturing defects. B. DISCLAIMERAs mentioned in Wolbrook's story: a Skindiver “Worldtimer” model was owned and worn by a famous test pilot and engineer.  His Skindiver tool-watch was recently auctioned and his brother confirmed its authenticity.As we have no certainty, we are not making any statement on any specific mission or plane. Our special editions are humbly paying tribute to outstanding mankind's achievments. We are sticking to the facts: this Skindiver "saw action" and by the look of it - wear and tears, faded marking on the bezel, along with a replacement military specs nylon strap - it did not stay in a  drawer. As many test pilot, astronaut or regular man through the 1960s and the 1970s owning a personal, extra or back-up watch on top of your standard issued watch was common sense and practice (Source: Hodinkee)C. Used in a normal way, for instance, they can't be used as a nutcracker.Reusability and recyclabilityAll watches are delivered with a pouch made of canvas and vegetable-tanned leather. All our packagings are using recycled cartons and can be recycled themselves. We choose not to use a traditional box that would be wasteful and costly for our environment. We also worked on the size to ensure efficient shipping and "low cost" for the environment.Sustainable materialsWe selected stainless steel as a base material for the watches. For now, we can not guarantee 100% the impact of the mining and transformation but at least all the metals used in our watches can be recycled. For our straps, we selected vegetable-tanned leathers that are less impactful on our environment than traditional leather that is tanned with chromium. For the nylon straps, we are using recycled nylon. For our packaging, all our watches will be delivered in a travel pouch made of eco-friendly canvas and vegetable-tanned leather, wrapped in a recycled carton.Environmentally friendly factoriesWhile we are strong believers that the watch industry as a long way to go, for our components, we choose factories with proper waste management. As a new player, we will try our best to move the status quo and environmentally friendly solutions will always our favor.Sustainable DistributionWe will try to have two to three shipping hubs to rationalize shipping: Europe, North America and Asia. story:
A high quality wallet suited for you! 

SERMAN BRANDS 1.0 Had the honor of being featured in GQ Magazine! 

                                      

So sleek, so slim,! 

Problem: Identity Theft is at All Time High. The Secret to Keeping Your Data Safe! Unless properly shielded, your card-based data is readily available when any active reader is in range!  

Solution: SERMAN BRANDS 5.0 is equipped with RFID Blocking technology. The Best Way to Protect Your Smart Cards from unwanted capture of data from your:

• Credit or Debit (for example: MC PayPass, VISA PayWave, AMEX expresspay, INTERAC Flash, etc.)

•Driver's license  

•Protects against access by NFC-equipped Smartphones

The RFID lining does not shield against some cards that operate at low frequencies of 125 kHz like hotel key cards, employee ID Badges, transit passes etc.

 

The perfect minimalist wallet so slim its capable of fitting any one of your pockets

Take your Serman Brands 1.0 model on any adventure and unveil its true vintage characteristics

Will arrive to you in a beautifully packaged gift box, made for any occasion or gift! 

Jet Black, Chocolate, Mohogany, Canyon Red, 4 out of the 7 designer colors available 

Texas Brown, California Desert, and charcoal black. The original 3 Vintage SERMANBRANDS colors 

Risks and challenges

SERMANBRANDS originated in a small town of California as Dad and the eldest son had a vision to create a family business. All aspects of this Kickstarter 1.0 project; from wallet design, creative design, pictures, and videos, were created exclusively by members of the SERMAN family.

After long dedicated work days they join the rest of the family for European originated dishes as Mama busily feeds nine children as well as encourages and blesses the Serman Brands team. Together the family supports their passions and keeps this dream in their prayers.

Risks and challenges

We value you, our supporters, and value our project.

We worked closely with our trusted supplier who helped us bring our last 3 Kickstarter project to life, in which we successfully delivered all the rewards/products. Our backers were satisfied!

Many years of experience has taught our team that although we are prepared in every aspect, unexpected events may come up that are not in our control. We ensure you, that we will take the necessary measures to directly communicate with you if any issue on shipping or production arises.

The Secret to Keeping Your Data Safe! Unless properly shielded, your card-based data is readily available when any active reader is in range!  Solution: SERMAN BRANDS 5.0 is equipped with RFID Blocking technology. The Best Way to Protect Your Smart Cards from unwanted capture of data from your:• Credit or Debit (for example: MC PayPass, VISA PayWave, AMEX expresspay, INTERAC Flash, etc.)•Driver's license  •Protects against access by NFC-equipped SmartphonesThe RFID lining does not shield against some cards that operate at low frequencies of 125 kHz like hotel key cards, employee ID Badges, transit passes etc. The perfect minimalist wallet so slim its capable of fitting any one of your pocketsTake your Serman Brands 1.0 model on any adventure and unveil its true vintage characteristicsWill arrive to you in a beautifully packaged gift box, made for any occasion or gift! Jet Black, Chocolate, Mohogany, Canyon Red, 4 out of the 7 designer colors available Texas Brown, California Desert, and charcoal black. The original 3 Vintage SERMANBRANDS colors Risks and challengesSERMANBRANDS originated in a small town of California as Dad and the eldest son had a vision to create a family business. All aspects of this Kickstarter 1.0 project; from wallet design, creative design, pictures, and videos, were created exclusively by members of the SERMAN family.After long dedicated work days they join the rest of the family for European originated dishes as Mama busily feeds nine children as well as encourages and blesses the Serman Brands team. Together the family supports their passions and keeps this dream in their prayers.Risks and challengesWe value you, our supporters, and value our project.We worked closely with our trusted supplier who helped us bring our last 3 Kickstarter project to life, in which we successfully delivered all the rewards/products. Our backers were satisfied!Many years of experience has taught our team that although we are prepared in every aspect, unexpected events may come up that are not in our control. We ensure you, that we will take the necessary measures to directly communicate with you if any issue on shipping or production arises.

story:
Lay-Flat TSA Compliant Laptop Pocket - no need to take your laptop out during airport security with the Ama Backpack!

Inside Ama's largest compartment are two neoprene inner pockets: one sized to fit up to a 15-inch laptop and strategically placed to lay flat when the backpack is unzipped. It's an ideal set up for getting through TSA checks without having to pull out your laptop.

 

With 7 different interior pockets ranging from soft-lined to see-through mesh, we have a place for all your valuables, tech accessories, and supplies: 

 

The Quila Bag can be worn 3 ways: as a crossbody, belt bag, and clutch

Ready for many roles, the Quila bag can be used as a clutch for a night out, a crossbody for weekend brunch and client meetings, or a chic belt bag. Top handle allows for easy carry as a clutch. Gold D-rings allow you to attach the adjustable shoulder strap to turn this bag into a crossbody.

 

With our adjustable vegan leather belt strap, the Quila bag can be turned into a stylish and hands-free bag that can be dressed up or down for everything from working events to running around with the kids. 

At PERSU, we know that having too many bells and whistles come at an aesthetic cost, and our solution has always been to design bags with the perfect balance of style and function. We include the functions you need, without the ones you don’t, in order to present you with gracefully designed, highly-functional bags with trim silhouettes and sleek materials for all your work, travel, and leisure activities.

Persu Collection bags have been featured in:

See what previous Kickstarter backers think about Persu:

I spent the last 3 years carefully researching, developing and testing multiple iterations and prototypes to finally create the perfect balance of style, function, and durability. Here is the history...

The Iterations of the Ama Backpack:

The Ama Backpack went through multiple sketches/cad concepts, 2 different size options, 2 exterior back colors, MANY MANY function tweaks, and 3 shape designs before finally reaching the final, perfected golden sample. 

The Evolution of the Quila Bag:

The Quila bag started off as a rectangular bag that evolved into a circular shape in order to have a more stylish look and improved belt functionality. I created and tested 4 samples to get to the final prototype.

Prototype Testing:

I personally tested every single prototype, while receiving feedback from hundreds of people over the last 3 years. I brought each prototype out with me on a day-to-day basis to ensure that each feature was necessary and useful - making tweaks to the prototype as needed. Tweaks that involved better placement for use, and increasing the ease of the functions. I also brought each prototype out on countless travels, testing the TSA-compliant compartment at many airports domestically, and internationally to ensure the function worked perfectly...and it did. :)  

Final Prototypes Product Demo:

Here is a simple, unedited continuous take demo of the final sample of the Ama Backpack and Quila Bag.

After 3 years of R&D, I am finally ready to bring the Ama Backpack and Quila Bag to life and in your hands, and I just need your help in funding the first round of production. With the golden samples ready to go and a trustworthy, quality manufacturer already secured, we are just around the corner from introducing the only two bags you need for all your work, travel, and leisure activities!

The Kickstarter goal is the minimum amount needed to produce these two new bags. If we are to exceed our goal and hit stretch goals, additional funds will go toward producing NEW COLORS of the Ama Backpack and Quila Bag that will include backers' feedback and suggestions. Together we can create beautiful, functional bags for our modern-day lifestyles. :)

TIMELINE

  •   OCTOBER 23, 2019: Campaign launches  
  •   NOVEMBER 22, 2019: Campaign ends 
  •   DECEMBER 2019: Production begins 
  • MAY 2020: The Ama Backpacks and Quila Bags out for delivery  

Meet Stephanie! 

As a solo, female entrepreneur, Stephanie Su first launched her line of premium and functional bags called Persu Collection on Kickstarter in 2015. Stephanie has a passion for designing functional yet sleek products while supporting and helping others to also "Persu" their dreams. She is an advocate of collaboration over competition, and a member of the latest cohort of female entrepreneurs in the F Project.

The Story

"After launching my first Kickstarter campaign in 2015, I was thrown into the fast-paced world of entrepreneurship. While constantly running from meeting to meeting, and traveling consistently domestically and internationally, I saw that there were two crucial bags missing from my collection: a backpack, and a small essentials-only bag. I needed a backpack that would make my travels easier, keep me organized, last for years to come (the ones I was using broke easily), and still maintain a sleek, clean exterior. And, I needed a smaller bag that could hold just my essentials, be versatile enough to transition from day to night, and allow me to be hands-free -without looking like a sporty fanny pack.

So, I spent the last 3 years designing two bags that could solve all these problems: the Ama Backpack and the Quila Bag. With a TSA-complaint laptop pocket in the Ama and over 20 features, this backpack can withstand the hustle and assist in all of life's work, travel, and leisure activities. And, the Quila Crossbody Belt Bag can be worn 3 ways, depending on how you need it, eliminating the need for multiple bags - all without compromising style."

-Stephanie Su, Founder + Designer of PERSU 

I designed these bags for the modern-day hustler (and am also one myself), so this time, I'm taking my Kickstarter challenge as an opportunity to increase my personal growth. I often find myself moving so quickly through life that I often neglect to give time to myself on a daily basis. So, for the 4-week run of my Kickstarter campaign, I will release a new #modernhustlerchallenge theme each week and hold myself accountable to follow-through on the activities. You will get all my #modernhustlerchallenge updates as a backer, and I'll include mini activities in case you would like to follow my challenge with me! 

My Team:

From L to R: Satomi, Angie, Me, Jane

Devin and I (and using the Quila bag)

Myself, My Dad (to my right), and his friends in Taiwan

While I'm a solo entrepreneur, I could not have brought these bags and this project to life without the monumental help of these 5 people: My Dad, Devin Scott, Jane La Motte, Satomi Yuinawa, and Angie Steele. My team has collectively put in hundreds of hours to assist me in manufacturing, videography, post-production, graphic design, photography, and project coordination. Thank you for being part of this long and tedious process and helping me bring my vision to life!

Some of you may be familiar with the first two bags I launched on Kickstarter in 2015 - the Tom and Jessica bags, named after my incredibly supportive parents. This time around, my two new bags are named after two equally important and extremely influential beings in my life. 

The Ama Backpack:

The Ama Backpack is named after none other than my amazing 94-year old grandmother who helped raise me from the day I was born. Ama (阿媽) is what I call her and it means ‘grandmother’ in the Taiwanese dialect. Like many incredible grandmothers out there, my Ama is the strongest yet most selfless and caring person I know. After raising six kids alone in Taiwan, my Ama came to the US to help take care of her 3 grandchildren after their father passed at a young age. Shortly after, when I was born, Ama then came to our house every single day to care for myself and my two siblings. Ama communicated most with her actions due to speaking only Japanese and Taiwanese because of the Japanese Occupation of Taiwan in her childhood. We communicate in the only language we share, a limited version of Mandarin. 

She never had a lot in terms of wealth, but she gave everything she had to everyone others and dedicated her entire life to help and care for those around her. I'll never be able to come close to matching what she's given me with her love, patience, sacrifice, and care, but I dedicate this backpack to my Ama -  ready to withstand anything the world could throw at her, and do it with ultimate class.

The Quila Bag:

The Quila bag is dedicated to the partner in crime I had for half of my life: my chihuahua Tequila who passed away in March of 2018. 

Tequila (also nicknamed "Quila") was the first purchase I made after receiving my first paycheck at 16 years old and was the best thing to have ever entered my life. A small but confident little guy, he made home a home for me and was by my side through all the rough teenage years, the typical quarter-life crisis, and the rollercoaster ride of this entrepreneurship journey. He was by my side during the two weeks I was in the garage packing 800 bags from my first Kickstarter campaign in 2015. And, although he didn't make it to see the final prototypes of this one, he did see the making of it.

So, I designed my new Crossbody Belt Bag in the spirit of Tequila. The lovely Quila is ready to be carried as a clutch or tucked under your arm as a shoulder bag, and can perform hands-free as a belt bag. 

I hope you’ll feel as I do that these two new stylish and versatile bags are inspired by passion and the spirit of two truly incredible and amazing beings.  

 

Please help us share the campaign!

Instagram: @persucollection

Facebook: Persu Collection

Twitter: @persucollection

YouTube

Pinterest: Persu Collection

I want to give a very special THANK YOU to everyone below. While this campaign is crowdfunded, the making of this project also couldn't have happened without the participation, efforts, feedback, and mentoring of all of these amazing people.  Thank you so much for your support of this journey, I couldn't make this campaign happen without you.  -Xoxo, Stephanie

My Right Hand: Jane La Motte

Videography, Post Production, Graphic Design, Photography, PR: Devin Scott, Satomi Yuinawa, Angela (Angie) Steele, Sheila Estaniel

Models: Brock Davies, Ru Scott, Tanya Scott, Pia Shah, Emily Wang, Nola and Easton Marti, Cindy Mao, Lexi Palozzi, Lucy Splichal, Sean Scott, Meron Yemane, Jeannine Savory, Angelica Pierre, Ashley Randall, Mari Simak, Jackie, Melissa Adao, Lesa Marie, Rochelle B., Michelle R., Samantha Hunter, Lezah Victoria, Maria Disla, Sucha Kumar, Marvin Madariaga

Sounding Board & Mentors: Virginia De Assis, Jey Wagner, Megan Sette, Miki Reynolds, Priya Barbera, Samantha Zhang, Brooke Tjarks, Mia Danilowicz, Eri Taniguchi, Kimi Rinchak, Sandy Vu, Kate Ogata, Amy Jones, Kyra McAndrews, Nicola Brown, Terri Johnson, Trevor Fong, Kelly Collins, Courtney Henderson, Marion Crampe, Samantha Carney, Amy Guion,  Kelsey Padigos, Julia Feiffenberger, Tom & Jessica Su

story:
NO/R™  ( No Rehearsal )


Dear friends & family,
  • I have found the love of my life. Creating beautiful premium leather accessories , purses.
  • I need a specialized sewing machine to continue to share my creations with the world. 



NO/R™ will feature  a new collection of original works inspired by contrasting concepts humanity is presented with as we continue this journey through life. To me each piece is reflection of moments in time an experiment with emerging technology wearable computers, lights, sensors and a fusion of the concepts of past and present due to my enchantment with merging everyday objects with technology.

This will also be the introduction of my one-of-a-kind purse creations. I look forward to presenting the finished pieces in gallery form and encouraging discussion surrounding the concepts presented in my ready to wear, handmade luxury collection called DICHOTOMIA that is an exploration of the dichotomies of style and living by NO/R™ 




What I Need 

  • I am looking to raise about $5000 for a Juki Single Needle Lockstitch Walking Foot Specifically Set up for Leather Sewing and other startup materials like leather, sculpting wax, mixed media, custom hardware and sewable electronics.



What I have been up to.

Introducing the Go! Convertible Clutch.
This is one of the purses that form a part of the NO/R TOKYO COLLECTION

Grounded, yet filled with soul - each hand stitched leather good is practical and pretty. Inspired by the sights and sounds of Japan, the Tokyo collection features simple lines with timeless styling. 

The GO! purse can be worn 5 ways! This is one of my favorites . A convertible cross body purse, hand sewn hand-stained genuine leather! 
___________________________




TheNO/R Clutch - TOKYO COLLECTION
___________________________


The Custom NO/R Card Holder - TOKYO COLLECTION
___________________________



What You Get


  • Of course, the majority of my works will continue to be hand made and stitched with love and I look forward to sending each one of my contributors their very special perks and thank you's!
  • If i supercede my goal will still use the funds to purchase more material, dedicate to training  and apprenticeship of myself (And pursue my accepted apprenticeship with amazing artist, sculptor and jewelry designer Jolanta Pawlak ) and others in order to  continue designing and creating limited edition pieces and experiences. 
  • There will always be a limited number of each design available. Each one will be numbered.
  • Helping me get this dream off the ground in to a studio and developing products that help bridge the gap between art technology ad living.


Where you can find me.

  • shop.norehearsal.co
  • etsy.com
  • Soon available on Jewelandlotus.com

Risks & Challenges

The risks and obstacle I would face would be not meeting demand, the obstacles are really not many except my own determination and stamina to keep creating, traveling and sharing my skills and inspiration with the world.

  • passion.
  • drive.
  • hardwork.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • I know some of you would love to contribute this might not be the right time. But please do share with others you feel may also believe in me, have some advice, ideas, inspiration for custom orders my door is open!
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools too!

story:
What We Need & What You Get:

  • We are currently re-manufacturing the current collection as seen below but are short $7,000 to complete the new collection in all of the color ways that make the collection complete.
  • Any funds raised will go directly into manufacturing even if we do not meet the $7,000 mark. The color selections will be limited if we do not get full funding due to manufacturing minimums but we 100% guarantee you will get  something from our collection either way.
  • Additional funds raised will go into the design process of the next collection
  • Most importantly, all funds raised will also get us closer to our 'giving back to Bali' campaign as described below.

How We Plan On Giving Back:

  • Once we reach our initial sales goal we will be contacting our Balinese friends to have promotional items made like bags, bracelets, headbands and more. We will be giving these items away as a gratuity to our customers with each Nadi purchase. The idea is to give work to people in developing nations so that they can provide for their families with a sense of pride and dignity... Teach a man to fish / give a man a fish concept! We want to give mothers and fathers work not free money. The word charity sounds nice but it creates dependence. We feel this will be the most effective way to give back. As we continue to grow I am sure we will be piggy banking new ideas on how to make an even greater impact.
  • We will start this campaign in Bali where Nadi Athletica was born and will spread to places like India, Morocco and Peru where my partners and I personally know families who would greatly appreciate work and be grateful to have additional means to provide for their families.


The Current Collection: We had a great response to our current collection giving us the courage to continue implementing new designs into the new summer collection. We are in the process of having the popular items re-manufactured in additional color ways.

 


Below you will see the New Collection. All of the new styles have gone through an extensive design process to ensure the fit is just right. All of the textiles were used in the first collection and have been proven to last wash after wash and hold up against some serious sweat so we know you all will be as satisfied with the new collection as customers were with our first collection.
Stretch Goal: Items Below
  • If we make it to $12,000 we will be able to manufacture the Payudara Bra and offer the sexy yet supportive bra in all 4 color ways.
  • If we get to 17,000 we will be able to make the Nyaman Loose Pants with Skirt available in all three color ways.


Risks and Challenges:

Manufacturing is always a challenge. The rule of thumb in this business is that manufacturing is 100% of the time NOT on time.

  • We got lucky, the first round of manufacturing we did here in the U.S.A. went smooth, but of course we ran into some hitches like out of stock fabric and long holiday seasons. Other than that we were very pleased with the quality of work and work ethic of our L.A. manufacturer.
  • We already have all of the fabrics in stock and ready to be cut and sewn!
  • As far as lead times, we found it is always good to put a 2 week pad on any manufacturing lead times, so your Perks would be available by beginning of June.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute by pledging to our campaign we would greatly appreciate any help to get the word out by posting this link to any social media or by sending an email to someone you think might be interested in what we are offering.
  • Also, there are the IndieGoGo share tools available to all of you! HINT HINT!


Please..... Feel free to contact me with any questions you might have about our campaign and I will make sure to get back to you within 24 hours!
story_txt:
What We Need & What You Get:
 
We are currently re-manufacturing the current collection as seen below but are short $7,000 to complete the new collection in all of the color ways that make the collection complete. Any funds raised will go directly into manufacturing even if we do not meet the $7,000 mark. The color selections will be limited if we do not get full funding due to manufacturing minimums but we 100% guarantee you will get  something from our collection either way. 
Additional funds raised will go into the design process of the next collection
Most importantly, all funds raised will also get us closer to our 'giving back to Bali' campaign as described below.
 How We Plan On Giving Back:  Once we reach our initial sales goal we will be contacting our Balinese friends to have promotional items made like bags, bracelets, headbands and more. We will be giving these items away as a gratuity to our customers with each Nadi purchase. The idea is to give work to people in developing nations so that they can provide for their families with a sense of pride and dignity... Teach a man to fish / give a man a fish concept! We want to give mothers and fathers work not free money. The word charity sounds nice but it creates dependence. We feel this will be the most effective way to give back. As we continue to grow I am sure we will be piggy banking new ideas on how to make an even greater impact. We will start this campaign in Bali where Nadi Athletica was born and will spread to places like India, Morocco and Peru where my partners and I personally know families who would greatly appreciate work and be grateful to have additional means to provide for their families.
