story:
THE FREE HOME CONCEPT

The Free Home Project is a revolutionary movement that redefines homeownership. Our vision is to showcase affordable and sustainable technology in a treetop rainforest environment. By simplifying our material needs and thinking outside the traditional norms, we can eliminate virtually all monthly housing and living expenses, allowing us to reshape how we spend our time.  The 'Free Home' Project exemplifies how homeownership can “free” us, rather than trap us, by working less to support our needs and allowing more time to pursue our passions. The 'Free Home' will run on sustainable and renewable resources, has no monthly expenses and is nearly maintenance-free, yet provides everything we need to live comfortably - shelter, running water, electricity, entertainment. Green living does not mean having to sacrifice modern amenities, but it can mean having a debt free, low stress, high quality life!

Join Matt New and Amy Marino, members of the 'Finca Family' in their adventure of creating 'El Mirador Bellavista'

This one-of-a-kind jungle dwelling infused with modern-day comforts is located at Finca Bellavista in the heart of the Costa Rican rainforest.  The Finca Bellavista community is part of a broader international family seeking to challenge society’s norms.  We invite you to come live and learn with us (or should you choose, just kick back and relax) during and after the construction of 'El Mirador' at Finca Bellavista. Our pledge prizes are designed to help you be a member of our team as we demonstrate how we can live sustainably, comfortably, and responsibly in one of the most biologically diverse places on the planet.



THE FUSION HOME - 

"EL MIRADOR BELLAVISTA"

What makes this house so special?

Experience, research and technology! We live in the jungle and we have a saying: 'The jungle always wins.'  Not anymore! 

Through testing countless products, we know we have designed and will build 'El Mirador' with the best materials and technologies available. Years of trial and error has taught us that the most appropriate products to use in this rainforest environment include recycled plastic, solar-powered technology and renewable products. Pura Vida!  Our goal is to share these hard learned lessons with you.

Aside from steel sub-framing, the dwelling will be built with the following materials: 

·  Trex Transcend (25 year warranty)

·  Railing/Louvers/Siding – Polypropylene

Water and Plumbing System 

·  WISY Pre-tank Filters

·  WISY Smoothing Inlets

·  WISY Floating Filters

·  WISY Overflow Devices Pumps

Rainwater will be collected with a rain catchment system. The slanted roof housing the solar panels will also divert water to a series of gutters for storage in an underground tank. A solar pump processes the water through a filtration system and provides potable water.

The Photovoltaic Solar System

·  LED Lighting

·  Smart Home System

·  Solar Water Heating System

The house will have door sensors, cameras and a smart control system, allowing online monitoring. Opening and closing curtains, dimming the lights and unlocking the doors can all happen from a smart phone anywhere in the world. The solar system has been specially designed for the house and is capable of functioning with no sun for two days.

For project and product details, please visit our BLOG

Want to know on average how much money is spent maintaining a conventional house? Here are two of the hundreds of websites detailing true costs.

Why your home is a terrible investment and Cost of owning a home


Our story has now been featured in: (and many more)


MEET THE 'FINCA FAMILY'


Mateo Hogan: Co-Founder and Chief Problem Solver

Mateo has extensive construction knowledge and has been at the core of the majority of the structures here at FBV. He is solution oriented, cares deeply for the local community, and is an adrenaline junkie that can be found surfing, dirt-biking or diving in the region surrounding the Finca.

Erica Hogan: Co-founder and Creative Director

Erica is a kind, generous individual who brings sunshine to the Finca even on a cloudy days. She loves Kimbo, her English Bulldog, more than anything (proof of her kindred spirit as only a mother could really love Kimbo!). Erica is the brains behind the whole operation and continues to find innovative ways to keep the community and its surrounding families together.

Matt New: Property Manager

Matt is a visionary with an entrepreneurial spirit who believes wholeheartedly in the concept of the 'Free Home' Project. His role as Finca Bellavista’s property manager has given him the experience and motivation to implement refined systems and technologies to take sustainability to a new level at Finca Bellavista. While he loves the jungle, he loves his technology and gadgets too. He is the mastermind behind the Free Home Project. He knows you can still achieve your dreams in a way that minimises your carbon footprint. 

Amy Marino: Reservations Manager & Volunteer Coordinator

Amy is a fun loving, unique person who brings out the best in people. She loves the Ticos (Costa Ricans) very much and enjoys teaching them English. She trains and looks after the volunteers and is awesome with the guests. Amy can be found assisting people in the office, serving drinks at Happy Hour or enjoying a good book when the moment calls.  Amy is the spirit and glue that holds us all together!

Rob: Kitchen Manager and Chef

Rob is the world’s greatest chef, period. Many of us wonder if we would still be here if not for his cooking. It will not go to his head though, because Rob openly admits that he cooks for the compliments, and boy does he get them! As Rob would say "you can't fake thirds". You only have to troll the Tripadvisor page to see that the rest of the world agrees! 

Kimbo: ‘Kimbo Slice’ is Mateo’s and Erica’s English bulldog. Kimbo was adopted in San Jose and is a popular character at Finca Bellavista. He can be a pretty endearing creature, yet also quite the troublemaker as well. 

click to read about Kimbo's epic adventure!

JOIN IN THE ADVENTURE!


We want you involved. Come visit us in Costa Rica and as 'El Mirador' is constructed. We are offering discounted vacations in Finca Bellavista’s beautiful existing  treehouses during the construction of 'El Mirador' Bellavista.  We are also offering the opportunity to stay in the new home following its construction to experience 'treetop Pura Vida' first hand.

We have created the pledge prizes so you get a great deal on the actual lodging, and we have thrown in a lot of extras.  Come and experience our special community and see if this lifestyle suits you. We welcome others to consider realizing their dreams here, who knows, you might fall in love and become our neighbor!

We appreciate the support and hope to see you here one day soon.


Information on how to make your reservation below


Our Structural Plans are Ready! (13/07/15). Woohoo........




Casa Mariposa - click for more details

   


How to make your reservation:

  • you can view the houses availability at any time through the Finca Bellavista reservations system, please click on the relevant house above to do so
  • once you have selected your desired dates, please purchase the required pledge prize and contact us below through the email link (we will make the reservation for you)
  • if purchasing a stay in the Fusion home (available December 2016 onwards), once pledged, please contact us via the email link and leave desired dates in the comments for others to see. Fusion home pledge prizes are transferable and redeemable for up to 5 years, you may select your dates anytime you choose. 
  • If you would like to personalise/edit the vacation, get in touch, were happy to help
  • Feel free to purchase and resell the vacation prizes, they are transferrable and can be redeemed within the next 2 years.
  • NO RISK GUARANTEE - If purchasing stays in 'El Mirador' and the construction of the fusion home is not completed before your desired dates (starting Dec 2016 onwards) then full refunds will be given.  
Please direct all indiegogo reservations using the "send Email" tab below or contact us through the comments section:
Send Email

A short documentary from Bruna Toledo:


Kimbo's Quest:



Finca Bellavista, by Matt Rath:

(Please check out our other videos and photos via the gallery tab)

story:
Ive had a fabulous career creating clothing for many wonderful clients from the various studios I have had over 20 years.

My Label was purely online as this saved costs that I could offset to you.

Going into business with a friend was the worst move ever, as she betrayed me after her desire to move into a shop which has made things difficult. 

However,, interest in the shop & business is better than ever but we have a 4 month deficit from her bailing out that we need to reimburse. Follow that with the venomous antics of a competitor who caused  3 weeks of hassle and losing sales on Facebook plus the stress of taking days off to sort this,, we have lost a lot of money!

If we can salvage this bill... then we can continue with the shop.. continue to create more wonderful items as we have the fabulous space for stock AND to work.. that we would otherwise not be possible from a garden shed or home that we might be forced to work from should we not raise the funds.

I am not asking for it all.  We do infact need nearer to £1000 but £500 is a start and would be so appreciated.

I woudnt mind if 500 people donated £1..

Its not for me... its for YOU... I could honestly resolve to a life of doing very little tho I would soon be in a padded cell with boredom lolol

If I dont raise all of it.. whatever I do get will go to the bills.... every penny.

I appreciate your support so much and for once, it would be nice to be helped rather than the one who is there for everyone else; giving them advice, money, skills, a home... sometimes the strong become vulnerable too. xxxx

story:
*Indiegogo campaign search image photographed by James Weber and Modeled  by  Roarie Yum.


What We Want to Do

With your help, we hope to formally introduce ourselves to the fashion world. adrinADietra is a budding luxury lingerie brand that would love to offer items that are typically not available in a multitude of sizes in high end intimate apparel, but are still sexy enough to fit seamlessly in each core and seasonal collection. Such items will include, mastectomy bras, maternity options, shape wear, and hard-to-find sizes such as lower bands and higher cups. Other notable services will include Made-To-Measure garments and alterations services on lingerie--something not commonly found in the US today. 

I would love to bring about the change that the Intimate Apparel industry needs by providing extensive alterations and consultations on lingerie regardless of where the purchase originated! Many companies complete alterations in-house or send the items to neighborhood cleaners, etc. only to get back botched items because of the lack of lingerie-specific knowledge the tailor possesses.  In other cases, lingerie alterations are being done ‘under-the-table’ by women that understand the construction methods but are working for a company that does not openly offer in-house alterations. Being another form of garment--intimates deserve the same care as the clothes we wear. 

Before Alterations 

After Alterations 

For more images and information, view the Alterations on Lingerie  blog post available at www.adrinadietra.wordpress.com 
I was motivated to start this company due to the lack of options for alterations experts in the intimate apparel world, the want to provide more options for women that either have a difficult time finding their size, or are in need of something specific and have to decide to settle on the best--though not perfect, option they have found after scouring their city. Last but certainly not least, my love of giving back to those in need was a huge motivator. 
As a sales associate with two children, it is quite difficult to raise needed funds to gain momentum.  This initial fund will help establish the most basic, yet still crucial foundations for the company.

How We Plan to do It

We plan to provide buyers and press with industry-specific packets.  These will provide information on current and future collections and allow for us to, vicariously, reach a greater amount of people and draw a more steady following.  Successful funding will allow for a full collection to be complete in a timely fashion.  This will then allow for revenue to come in to at least self fund another collection.  Eventually, we hope for it to grow enough to expand and build onto the company.

To accomplish all goals years down the line from this fundraiser would mean, we have successfully created a widely known, self-funding  luxury lingerie brand.  We will have started to set up funds to give back to the underprivileged and will have formed partnerships with related organizations to help their causes. {i.e. Breast Cancer Awareness, Homeless/Battered Women Garment Donations, etc.}

Being that our Creator/Head Designer can relate to the vast majority of issues we plan to address during the various stages of our company's growth {Very small band, larger/fuller cup size, recent mommy}, we have no doubt at the success of being able to genuinely express and push the necessity of what we are offering!

What the Money is For

These funds will be to help in several areas:

 1. Finalize samples and put into production the A/W 15 collection we are currently working on.

2. Create official business cards, press packs, etc. to hand out to various buying and marketing teams.

The breakdown is as listed below:
  • Fabrics & Trims . $15oo
  • Factory Production . $15oo
  • Labels, Tags, & Other Packaging . $5oo
  • Business Cards, Press/Buyer Packs, Lookbook . $5oo
  • Misc., { IndieGogo Fees, Perk Shipping Fees, Mistakes} . $2oo

Total . $4,2oo


Where We Are in the Process

  • Fabric, trim, and notion suppliers have been sourced. We need funding to finish our samples and start formal production
  • Production venues have been sourced
  • Pattern drafting has begun
  • Production samples have begun to be draped and sewn
  • Lookbook, buying sheet, and illustration packet layout and shoot planning has begun
  • Multiple press & buyer interest has begun to gather

So far, adrinADietra has made its rounds to 12 US states, 5 countries, and 3 continents around the globe via on and offline sales. We hope, within a minimum of 5 - 10 years, to grow enough to open our first brick-and-mortar boutique, in which custom fittings and alterations can be performed in person and allow for completed garments to be picked up and received in a more timely fashion.

We do know, initially, we will mostly have to focus on products that will gain the quickest following and will not have full availability for alterations or vast size/style range production. As the company grows, we plan to create pop-up shops and have trunk shows in both the US and Europe, to start, where in person fittings and alterations can be completed or dropped off! These trunk shows will allow us to gauge what styles of items and sizes are in highest demand.

Exceeding our funding will help towards gaining a studio space that we can rent monthly and have buyers preview and purchase collections, stylists review and pull for editorial shoots, and customers would have a place to have in-person fittings and alterations consultations.


A.D Orders Packaged & Ready to Ship


Close up of a lounge gown from the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign.


Close up of the making of an eyemask  from the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign.


Close up of the back of a lounge gown and wireless bra from the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign.


Preview of the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign. These illustrations will serve as the template for the post cards and will be reworked into illustration plates for perks.


We have already been featured in magazines such as W25 {Issue 45, Timor Razz's 'Sense' spread} and Inked Girls {September/October 2013 Issue}. We have been invited to be featured in several other well-known publications but lack of self funding has continuously stalled production. The success of this fundraiser will open the door for more clientele, buyers, publications, and stylists to become aware of our brand.


A.D Thigh Garters Featured in Inked Girls Magazine

If the funds raised happen to fall short of our goal, we will at least use the money gained towards the two most major necessities-- purchasing fabrics and trims as well as producing our collection.
We thank you in advance for any contribution you give--be it monetary or by just spreading the word!
Thanks All ^_^
Very Respectfully,
Team A.D

*If you are interested in becoming an investor, please email us at info@adrinADietra.com to request a Proposal Pack when they become available.

What We Want to Do

With your help, we hope to formally introduce ourselves to the fashion world. adrinADietra is a budding luxury lingerie brand that would love to offer items that are typically not available in a multitude of sizes in high end intimate apparel, but are still sexy enough to fit seamlessly in each core and seasonal collection. Such items will include, mastectomy bras, maternity options, shape wear, and hard-to-find sizes such as lower bands and higher cups. Other notable services will include Made-To-Measure garments and alterations services on lingerie--something not commonly found in the US today. 
I would love to bring about the change that the Intimate Apparel industry needs by providing extensive alterations and consultations on lingerie regardless of where the purchase originated! Many companies complete alterations in-house or send the items to neighborhood cleaners, etc. only to get back botched items because of the lack of lingerie-specific knowledge the tailor possesses.  In other cases, lingerie alterations are being done ‘under-the-table’ by women that understand the construction methods but are working for a company that does not openly offer in-house alterations. Being another form of garment--intimates deserve the same care as the clothes we wear. 
Before Alterations 
After Alterations 
For more images and information, view the Alterations on Lingerie  blog post available at www.adrinadietra.wordpress.com 

I was motivated to start this company due to the lack of options for alterations experts in the intimate apparel world, the want to provide more options for women that either have a difficult time finding their size, or are in need of something specific and have to decide to settle on the best--though not perfect, option they have found after scouring their city. Last but certainly not least, my love of giving back to those in need was a huge motivator. 
As a sales associate with two children, it is quite difficult to raise needed funds to gain momentum.  This initial fund will help establish the most basic, yet still crucial foundations for the company.




How We Plan to do It

We plan to provide buyers and press with industry-specific packets.  These will provide information on current and future collections and allow for us to, vicariously, reach a greater amount of people and draw a more steady following.  Successful funding will allow for a full collection to be complete in a timely fashion.  This will then allow for revenue to come in to at least self fund another collection.  Eventually, we hope for it to grow enough to expand and build onto the company.

To accomplish all goals years down the line from this fundraiser would mean, we have successfully created a widely known, self-funding  luxury lingerie brand.  We will have started to set up funds to give back to the underprivileged and will have formed partnerships with related organizations to help their causes. {i.e. Breast Cancer Awareness, Homeless/Battered Women Garment Donations, etc.}
Being that our Creator/Head Designer can relate to the vast majority of issues we plan to address during the various stages of our company's growth {Very small band, larger/fuller cup size, recent mommy}, we have no doubt at the success of being able to genuinely express and push the necessity of what we are offering!



What the Money is For
These funds will be to help in several areas:
 1. Finalize samples and put into production the A/W 15 collection we are currently working on.
2. Create official business cards, press packs, etc. to hand out to various buying and marketing teams.

The breakdown is as listed below:
Fabrics & Trims . $15oo

Factory Production . $15oo

Labels, Tags, & Other Packaging . $5oo

Business Cards, Press/Buyer Packs, Lookbook . $5oo

Misc., { IndieGogo Fees, Perk Shipping Fees, Mistakes} . $2oo

Total . $4,2oo


Where We Are in the Process


Fabric, trim, and notion suppliers have been sourced. We need funding to finish our samples and start formal production
Production venues have been sourced
Pattern drafting has begun
Production samples have begun to be draped and sewn
Lookbook, buying sheet, and illustration packet layout and shoot planning has begun
Multiple press & buyer interest has begun to gather



So far, adrinADietra has made its rounds to 12 US states, 5 countries, and 3 continents around the globe via on and offline sales. We hope, within a minimum of 5 - 10 years, to grow enough to open our first brick-and-mortar boutique, in which custom fittings and alterations can be performed in person and allow for completed garments to be picked up and received in a more timely fashion.
We do know, initially, we will mostly have to focus on products that will gain the quickest following and will not have full availability for alterations or vast size/style range production. As the company grows, we plan to create pop-up shops and have trunk shows in both the US and Europe, to start, where in person fittings and alterations can be completed or dropped off! These trunk shows will allow us to gauge what styles of items and sizes are in highest demand.
Exceeding our funding will help towards gaining a studio space that we can rent monthly and have buyers preview and purchase collections, stylists review and pull for editorial shoots, and customers would have a place to have in-person fittings and alterations consultations.


A.D Orders Packaged & Ready to Ship


Close up of a lounge gown from the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign.


Close up of the making of an eyemask  from the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign.

Close up of the back of a lounge gown and wireless bra from the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign.

Preview of the upcoming AW15 collection being funded by this campaign. These illustrations will serve as the template for the post cards and will be reworked into illustration plates for perks.

We have already been featured in magazines such as W25 {Issue 45, Timor Razz's 'Sense' spread} and Inked Girls {September/October 2013 Issue}. We have been invited to be featured in several other well-known publications but lack of self funding has continuously stalled production. The success of this fundraiser will open the door for more clientele, buyers, publications, and stylists to become aware of our brand.


A.D Thigh Garters Featured in Inked Girls Magazine
If the funds raised happen to fall short of our goal, we will at least use the money gained towards the two most major necessities-- purchasing fabrics and trims as well as producing our collection.

We thank you in advance for any contribution you give--be it monetary or by just spreading the word!
Thanks All ^_^Very Respectfully,
Team A.D


*If you are interested in becoming an investor, please email us at info@adrinADietra.com to request a Proposal Pack when they become available.

story:
Or, do you keep your gun loaded and in a “safe place” that is readily accessible to you in a crisis, but that you are just certain your children don’t know about?  

As gun owners and parents ourselves, we faced the same problem you do: how to balance our desire to be both ready in a crisis and responsible in normal, everyday situations. 

The Veri-Fire Team is uniquely equipped to solve this problem.  We have a broad range of experience spanning U.S. Military, law enforcement, firearms and special tactics, small business startups, large-scale government contracts and acquisition management and Silicon Valley corporate program management.

We invented Guardian to solve the challenge of responsibly securing handguns while maintaining unprecedented readiness.


Veri-Fire Guardian is the first product of its kind. 

Guardian is not a smart gun.  It is a safety device that attaches to the trigger guard of your handgun via a custom adapter.


Guardian's spring-loaded, light-weight, metal slide physically blocks access to the trigger of your handgun when pulled to the rear and locked.


When an authorized user authenticates via fingerprint, Guardian unlocks allowing the slide to snap forward granting access to the handgun trigger.


Guardian is self-contained, can store up to 5 user profiles and comes equipped with a manual override in the unlikely event of a malfunction or expired battery.

The final production version of Guardian (shown above) will include the following features:

With Guardian, your handgun can be unlocked and ready in less than a second and reliably secured just as quickly.


Do you have additional questions? 

Check out our extensive FAQs page for answers. 

Also, visit our Handgun Compatibility List to see if Guardian is compatible with your handgun.

"As a Father, a Husband and a Police Officer I would ask any gun owner to take a look at the Guardian by Veri-Fire."

 - Mark Ashby, 20-year Law Enforcement Veteran

"Guardian isn't a gun. It's an add-on that fits most standard handguns, and locks the trigger until the owner unlocks it with their index finger...if Veri-Fire raises the money it needs to get Guardian out to market, the effect could be the same: To keep kids from accidentally shooting themselves and each other."

- The Daily Beast

"...roughly 32 million handguns could benefit from a lock like the Guardian, and if even one percent of those gun owners attach a lock to their weapon, that’s 320,000 more guns that toddlers can’t fire. It’s a gun safety approach so basic, even the NRA is tentatively on board."

- Popular Science

Over the last six years, we've poured our lives into creating Guardian and we couldn't be more proud of the product today, but if Guardian saves just one life it will all be worth it.



We have refined Guardian through eight different iterations and five different designs to be the best product it can be.

 We are ready to move Guardian into final design and production, but to manufacture a product like this is expensive.  In order to bring Guardian to market, we need your help.

Join us and together we can change the way the world views gun safety.


 We know this is bigger than ourselves and we look to you, responsible gun owners and community members, to be a part of this journey with us.  In order to bring Guardian to the world, we need to raise a minimum of $100,000 to cover a portion of the upfront manufacturing costs.

Whether we reach our goal or not, we are committed to bringing Guardian to the world.  Any remaining amount needed will require business loans or access to other sources of large-scale funding.  However, banks and investors need to see that supporters like you demand this product.

As a thank you for your early support, we've created some great perks at incredible discounts! 


Maybe you don’t have the ability to support monetarily but, like us, believe in this solution and want to change the way the world views gun safety.  This is the very reason we created the Guardian referral system. This system enables you to get perks (including Guardian) and even achieve membership in our exclusive key community without spending a single dollar.  

All you have to do is sign up for an Indiegogo account (required to receive credit for your referrals) and start spreading the word!  Click below for details on how to make and track referrals:

https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660683-How-To-Participate-In-A-Referral-Contest

The success of this effort will require a vast community of supporters who are ready to do whatever they can to ensure its success.  If you are unable to participate in the referral system, then watch this brief video on how to invite your friends to like the Veri-Fire Facebook page.

When we reach our goal, the $100,000 will be used to cover a portion of the upfront manufacturing costs..  We can only begin to pay the remaining manufacturing cost and cost of operations (like our salaries) once we exceed our goal.
Keep an eye out for secret stretch goals.  We'll reveal those one by one once we reach our initial goal.  Check back with this campaign page or look for our updates via email and social media for details.

Reaching our funding goal will enable us to execute our planned production schedule.  There are a lot of moving pieces to this effort and many opportunities for unexpected delays from our suppliers and manufacturers.  That said, we have the experience to mitigate risk and manage this process to the best possible outcome. 

Assuming minimal delays, our current production schedule would put Guardian in your hands by July 2016.


Our team members have led security operations for multi-billion-dollar nuclear weapons, managed multi-million dollar projects, and consulted in the private sector.  We’ve managed programs in both the corporate and government sectors.  Our team has a collective 40 years of large-scale project management and over 75 years of leadership, management, administrative, budgetary and business expertise.  

But, at the end of the day, we are like you.  We grew up on farms and in the suburbs, have lived in small towns and big cities, served in the military, both in the states and abroad, but, most importantly, we are parents.  Parents who would protect those we love at all costs and own handguns for that very reason.  


Our mission is to save lives and we are dedicated to that effort.

Over the last 6 years there have been many challenges and we know there will be many more to come.  That said, we understand having the privilege of an idea that can change the world as we know it and the responsibility to bring it to you.

That said, we recognize that this idea has the potential to change the way the world views gun safety and the responsibility that this places on us. 

Our commitment to you is that Veri-Fire Guardian will be the highest-quality firearm safety device that you've ever owned.  As such, we will warranty Guardian for 1-year from the date of delivery.  

Ready, Reliable, Responsible.

Guardian is the Lock. 

You are the Key.

story:
About this project

Which woman doesn‘t know this situation? You‘ve found the perfect outfit.. but you can‘t find a matching handbag. The only one in the matching color is either too big or too small. Wouldn‘t it be nice to hava a handbag that always matches your outfit?

That is our idea! We‘ve developed a new kind of handbag which adapts to your outfit.


Imagine your handbag would have always the matching color to your outfit. With our handbag that becomes possible! Through the integrated LEDTechnic you transform your handbag to a chameleon. 

Most of the time you‘ll find handbags in the common colors black, brown or white. With our development you‘ve got 5 colors in one handbag.


With the integrated Control Unit you can choose between green, yellow, red, blue and purple and you can not only change the color, but also the way the handbag should shine. Are you at the club or a place where you like to attract attention? Just switch to the „fade“ option and the handbag automatically cycles through the whole color-spectrum.



Our first model is made out of leatherette, with a nice ribbon on top and offers the possibility to be transformed into a clutch by removing the chain.


On the inside you‘ll find all the electronic parts neccessary for the LED-Panel - these are neither visible nor can you feel them. The power supply requires two regular batteries and with the remote control, which is included, you have the possibility to control your handbag.


We‘ve got a lot of great ideas for the future. Those include different models made out of different materials like suede and other fabrics. And even different sizeses and models - not only for women.. Backbacks and tote bags are already planned.


 Now its your turn! Do you like our idea? Can‘t you wait to get your hands on your own LED Handbag as well? Then please support us - here!

To go into production with the first model, the clutchbag, we need to raise 5.000 USD. And we can only reach that goal with you guys! Of course we‘d like to give you something back for your help.


Funding

The biggest issue that we face has been raising capital to manufacture our first order. 

The amount of funding required to get the project running is quite substantial. We have already invested a lot of money in designing and creating our samples.

In order to launch our project we need to pay the manufacturers and transportation costs.

We intend to overcome this issue by reaching out to Indiegogo!

We have a great project and we desperately need your backing!


The last thing I’ll ask of you…


Please share! We’re going to raise our goal through people like you who spread the word about our campaign.

Here are a simple Facebook post that you can copy and paste right onto your own page:

Voting with my dollars by supporting Von Ellen and the Color Changing LED bag. Here’s to changing the fashion.
http://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/4f6ce728

story:
Note on video's, there are references to Wrister in some video clips, we used this name as the product was under development and it is mentioned in some videos. The name of our product is WristFlex and any references to other names is inadvertent.



















ITERATIONS OF WRISTFLEX DESIGNS













This is how you compete with a video game



Another version of WristFlex we are designing will hold a cell phone.  The cell phone WristFlex will not flip your phone like this version, but will allow the cell phone to drop into your palm from the wrist strap! Like every WristFlex, the Phone WristFlex will be able to securely hold the cell phone along your wrist when not in use.  See the video for an example.

story:
DVINE Invincible Tawny Serum was chosen as one of the 16 top products of the year at ELLE International Beauty Awards 2015!

This is just one of many reasons why you should scroll down, meet the brand, get on board and pre-order your DVINE products at amazing prices!


DVINE - FUSION COSMETICS

A New Premium Cosmetic Concept 

DVINE is creating a new generation of cosmetics, bringing the Purity, the High Tolerance and the Sustainability from the Biological Side with the Performance, the Effectiveness and the Luxury of the Classical Philosophy, materializing in luxury eco- sustainable products with high quality and... very sensual.

Products focused on skin’s youthfulness with privileges for all senses: texture, touch, colour... aroma!

Sparkling colours, masterful textures and an enriched aroma profile with notes of Port Wine for a unique and eccentric cosmetic genome.


PORTWINE DNA - Douro Nuclear Aroma

Port Wine is a sweet and fortified liqueur wine, produced exclusively in the Douro Valley. 

The Douro Valley is not a vineyard area whatsoever! This is the only place in the world that produces Port wine. Do you know many regions that are the source of unique products in the world?!


When visiting this region you must notice what we can visually call the Douro's brand image: the terraces slopes! Douro's architecture is not by chance. There our view achieves a very unique region in pure state, which combines the strengths of the soil, weather and Man's handwork. Local communities have adapted to the territory's specific conditions, in many aspects hostile to life, transforming them into survival factors.

The soil is stony shale, the temperature ranges are huge, the terrain is rough, cut by numerous rivers and mountain streams.

It is not easy for plants to develop here. So, Man gave them a hand by creating these terraces slopes that house the vineyard but one thing is certain: the vines and vineyards that revenge here have a brutal sap vitality. They are rich in its constitution and the grape's varieties are improved. This explains the identity strength of the area's natural elements. And these are the elements we bring to the products!

Being the world of cosmetics a worship world of beauty and uniqueness, we felt we had to create the DVINE! The first oenological line with the aromas of Port Wine. Without pseudoscience, without giving in to market trends or advertising hyperboles.


What We Need


Our priority is Product Manufacturing, so as soon as we have the necessary funds we'll start producing your perks! 

Don't you worry, we'll make sure you get them even if we don't reach our goal. So grab this amazing chance!


What You Get

By getting on board, you can receive first hand the new products we'll be able to produce and distribute. Check out the amazing perks we have for you!

Please contact us for shipping information and pricing at customerservice@douroskincare.com.


The Impact of your Support

With your pre-orders we'll be able to manufacture 4 new DVINE products:

  • DVINE Grape Water Cleansing Gel
  • DVINE Grape Floral Water Facial Tonic
  • DVINE Grape Skin and Pips Facial Scrub
  • DVINE Grape Power Dynamic Day Emulsion

This process entails the transformation of the prototypes (lab samples that correspond to the final formulations developed by us and duly tested) into final products. Which involves the following:

  • Buy plastic Tubes of 125 mL under a minimium order quantity
  • Buy plastic PET Bottles of 200 mL, screw caps and reducer plugs under a minimium order quantity
  • Buy ECOCERT Glass Airless Bottles of 50 mL, pumps and caps under a minimium order quantity
  • Cartons made of paper from sustainable forests (FSC) for each product
  • Inner liners to ensure that the products don't balance inside the carton
  • Shipping boxes

  • Portwine DNA Fragrance - the secret ingredient!
  • Manufacture the 4 formulations (1 batch per formula)
  • Handling and logistics
  • Industrial Property Protection
  • Submissions for Authorities outside EU
  • Promotion

DVINE - Awards & Media


A DVINE Team

We are a team of 4, with 3 pharmacists and 1 economist. A specialized team with the know-how to create truly rich and effective cosmetics manufactured under the highest pharmaceutical quality standards, compiling with all the requirements of the EU Cosmetic Regulation.


Want to get in touch with us?

Do you want to get on board the DVINE's campaign on Indiegogo and don't know how? Are you having trouble in pre-ordering your brand new DVINE products? Do you have questions or doubts regarding the raw materials or the products? 

We would love to hear from you! Contact us: customerservice@douroskincare.com.

The soil is stony shale, the temperature ranges are huge, the terrain is rough, cut by numerous rivers and mountain streams.
It is not easy for plants to develop here. So, Man gave them a hand by creating these terraces slopes that house the vineyard but one thing is certain: the vines and vineyards that revenge here have a brutal sap vitality. They are rich in its constitution and the grape's varieties are improved. This explains the identity strength of the area's natural elements. And these are the elements we bring to the products!
Being the world of cosmetics a worship world of beauty and uniqueness, we felt we had to create the DVINE! The first oenological line with the aromas of Port Wine. Without pseudoscience, without giving in to market trends or advertising hyperboles.







What We Need
 

Our priority is Product Manufacturing, so as soon as we have the necessary funds we'll start producing your perks! 
Don't you worry, we'll make sure you get them even if we don't reach our goal. So grab this amazing chance!


What You Get
By getting on board, you can receive first hand the new products we'll be able to produce and distribute. Check out the amazing perks we have for you!


Please contact us for shipping information and pricing at customerservice@douroskincare.com.
The Impact of your Support
 

With your pre-orders we'll be able to manufacture 4 new DVINE products:


DVINE Grape Water Cleansing Gel
DVINE Grape Floral Water Facial Tonic
DVINE Grape Skin and Pips Facial Scrub
DVINE Grape Power Dynamic Day Emulsion


This process entails the transformation of the prototypes (lab samples that correspond to the final formulations developed by us and duly tested) into final products. Which involves the following:



Buy plastic Tubes of 125 mL under a minimium order quantity


Buy plastic PET Bottles of 200 mL, screw caps and reducer plugs under a minimium order quantity


Buy ECOCERT Glass Airless Bottles of 50 mL, pumps and caps under a minimium order quantity


Cartons made of paper from sustainable forests (FSC) for each product

Inner liners to ensure that the products don't balance inside the carton
Shipping boxes




Portwine DNA Fragrance - the secret ingredient!

Manufacture the 4 formulations (1 batch per formula)
Handling and logistics

Industrial Property Protection

Submissions for Authorities outside EU
Promotion


DVINE - Awards & Media







A DVINE Team


We are a team of 4, with 3 pharmacists and 1 economist. A specialized team with the know-how to create truly rich and effective cosmetics manufactured under the highest pharmaceutical quality standards, compiling with all the requirements of the EU Cosmetic Regulation.

Want to get in touch with us?
Do you want to get on board the DVINE's campaign on Indiegogo and don't know how? Are you having trouble in pre-ordering your brand new DVINE products? Do you have questions or doubts regarding the raw materials or the products? 
We would love to hear from you! Contact us: customerservice@douroskincare.com.

story:
Short Summary

Here`s a little intro of what we are and what we do.


    We are Eric and Paula, and what we do is graphical designs on clothing.All kinds of styles on all kinds of fabrics.
    Us- it began a little while a go, not much, yet it made us realize,that our ideas combined can be useful in the world of design and art.
    LABIBOSS is a project for now, where creative minds will make individual new designs for every  culture it self and make it suitable for everyday clothing. It`s important because we can manage our skills into a ready- to - wear fashion that most young people and adults will like.
      To help Us achieve our goals we need is a camera,a website,online shop and a laptop that can handle heavy files and  programs.

What We Need & What You Get

  •  We are not asking for much, the primary need is for a camera,for better quality pictures and videos (600 €). In the near future we will need an online shop(400 €), a computer (500 €) and a studio (500 €)The amount could be around 2000 € .
 This is what we can give you:
  • for every 1 € we will give a personal thanks, and a post on our LABIBOSS time line.
  • for every 10 € we will send out a package of Latvian sweets.
  • for every 25 € you will get a hand sewn linen teddy bear with Latvian traditional symbols.
  • for evrey  35 € we will send out a LABIBOSS T-shirt with your size and the colour you want.
  • for every 50 € we will give a teddy bear and a T-shirt 
  • for every 100 €  we will send out a package of Latvian sweets,a T-shirt and  a  linen teddy bear.

The Impact

This is the difference your help will make:
  • Why is this important? Because only our design will make a difference in peoples personalities just by wearing a good t- shirt, simply- a 2 in 1 clothing, that combines style and  good fashion sense. 
  • We have already started offering our designs our page on facebook - https://www.facebook.com/labilabiboss
  • So far it has been successful, but hast reached as much people as we wanted.By making this site more available will already be a half way progress.

story:
• Tired from searching for interesting gift?
  • Do you always buy chocolate, alcohol or perfumes?
  • Do you really hit expectations?

We want to help you to get right gift for your beloved ones, friends or business partner. Say goodbye to frustration from boring gift-hunt and hello to happy beloved ones and friends.


The idea

This campaign is about help, joy and relationships. It’s based on my own story when I was on business trip and on the way back prior to flight at huge international airport I was unable to buy any present for my 5 year’s old son. In the whole airport there was only one and very little toyshop and I was unable to buy anything there. The rest of shops were only chocolate or perfumes or alcohol.

I’ve felt desperate and really embarrassed when I’ve came home. Just imagine those big awaiting eyes of your child when you return home after long journey. Of course he or she is happy they see you. But a while later they await something, some little present you’ve brought them, some proof you’ve thought about them when you’ve been away. And when you give them that little present the joy in their faces is priceless... And that night they fall asleep with their new present and are thinking with love about dad or mom...



And this story has brought me to an idea how to help people to make others a bit more happy...

So what this project is all about?


This project is about little presents for your beloved ones or your business partners. The presents should be high quality models of transportation vehicles like planes, locomotives, cars, ships etc.

Now you can say what’s the difference? Your question is very legitimate – there are millions of models around at every toy shop.

The difference is in the following basic points:

  • quality of our models – if you really look on common models at toy shops they are quite low quality and often plastic ones or at best mixture of plastic and metal. Our models will be metal only and of high quality.

  • design of our models – they will be painted in one color only giving the model attractive look that not only children will be proud of, but it will serve as a very representative present for adults to place it on their work desk as luxury accessory. (even general manager is still man and we all know every man is boy deep in the heart :-) )

  • and last but not least our models will be available in vending machines at airports or train stations etc. where you can easily buy it 24 hours a day 365 days a year during your journeys. Another sale spots will be gas stations, subway and train stations, hotel souvenirs shops and of course e-shop.


What We Need & What You Get

We have the aim to make this thing global - have it at every important airport and other places so that we can help millions.

Why do we need such high sum?

As almost every perk includes model, just to cover perks high sum is needed. But to cover only that production the project couldn't go actually live. And we want to make it really live so that not only we can be proud every time somebody buys our product as present to make somebody happy, but we also want to make you proud being the supporter. Everytime you would see somewhere the product being sold you can say to yourself: "I've helped!"

What we need to cover:

  • production costs of models - this is the highest expense
  • tailor made fully automated internet connected vending machines
  • the whole multilingual e-shop system
  • mobile apps for iOS and Android
  • marketing costs


What will you get?

Participation and perks. As we really want you to be part of the project, we've involved some special perks - not only special editions but also limited editions nobody else would have right to buy. Grab them till they are available.



Details

Product description

Model itself - made from metal only of size of about 6" (15 cm) with stand.


Little book - the book should describe basic information about the vehicle with photos from real life and any interesting data. This way the owner of the model can have much better idea about the thing. For example did you know that big jumbo consumes 64 200 gallons of fuel for 9 200 miles? That’s a lot. But even with such a huge consumption it is more efficient than to drive that distance by usual car (counted with 2 persons in one car for that distance)!


Box itself - it not only will look great and very deluxe. It also is practical where child can store his treasures after taking out his model. By the way the box will be of perfect prism shape so you can easily pack it into gift paper and it will look then as ideal present – next time you’ll be shopping notice how many toys are being sold in blister packages – when one tries to pack it he will wind up in a messy looking something.

(usual blister packaging and as present)

(our box)

We'd like to set the price at as most affordable level as possible. It should cost $13-$15.


E-shop and Mobile app
The plan is to support the vending machines with good e-shop so one can easily buy any models also online and not only on airports or train stations.

In order to be able to follow the models line, we have a plan to build a mobile application for iOS and Android where one can store information what models he already owns and what other ones he’d like to have.

The app will be online and offline solution. Yes, in today’s world offline solutions are very rare. But the point here is it’s better to use some memory in one’s smartphone and being able to study and go over models during flight and get much more reality of what one has just bought for his beloved one than just to sit and wait for landing and internet reconnection.

And every time one is online the app switches into online mode, downloads news, new models etc.

One can create his own profile either online on web (in e-shop) or in the app where he can store information what models he already owns and models he wishes to have – he just puts them into wish list. And it really wouldn’t matter if you’ve just marked ownership of new model in the app or via web as it will synchronize with each other.


Why name ThetaGifts?
Maybe one of your questions is why the name ThetaGifts?!?

Theta is originally the eighth symbol of Greek alphabet and it represents several meanings. Egyptians used it to denote soul, spirit, thought or life. And that’s what our models should do. They should bring about or support better relationships with your beloved ones or your friends or business partners. They should represent you in the soul of the person whom you’ve presented one of our models. Every time he or she sees it they remember you, think of you.



Risks & Challenges

The project is basically very easy and with our experiences in business and customer’s attitude we are quite sure we’ll keep everything what is written here.

There is a risk of delay caused by our intention to get really high quality product and so we have to put lot of stress in product detailed designing that way factory will be able to produce it in such quality.

We do not expect any big challenges regarding goods registration or customs.

There is challenge to keep the price hopefully everywhere at approximately same level. It depends very much on local taxes and conditions of particular airport.


FAQ

1.  What material will be the models made from?

Metal alloy composed of zinc, aluminium and copper. This is standard alloy used for manufacturing of metal models. Special and limited editions could be made also from other materials.

2.  What’s the business strategy?

As it is stated above in project description – the main business strategy will be built on sale via vending machines, e-shop and retailers (toy shops, gas stations, present shops, souvenir shops etc.) There will be two main distribution points – one in the USA and one in the European Union. The rest of the world will be covered from those two points at the beginning. Later there will be very likely more distribution points.

3.  What will be the price of models?

All the standard models will have the same price. The plan is to keep as low price as possible – according to the data what we’ve gathered it should be around $ 13-15. There is lot of factors influencing the price – local taxes, rent at airport, brand fees, maintenance, employees etc., but it all should be fine within the price stated above. In case of any radical local conditions in some single cases the price can be different.

4.  At what airports you’d like to start?

We’d like to start at some of the busiest airports in the world, but it also depends on logistics and some other factors. There anyway will be kind of pilot run at some airport (probably Vienna airport which has traffic more than 20 million of  passengers annually. In USA it should be Tampa, Florida (traffic of about 16 million of passengers annually). Right after pilot run we’ll jump on big airports - namely London Heathrow (almost 65 mil. passengers per year); Frankfurt, Germany (49 millions); Atlanta, USA (no. 1 in the world with it’s 80 million passengers per year); JFK New York (53 millions); Chicago (70 millions) etc.

5.  What models will you start with?

We’d like to release 10 types of models in first wave. There we definitely would like to cover well known planes like Boeing 747, Airbus A380 and some army planes like F16 or SU-27 Flanker as well as other significant aircrafts. We welcome any proposals to fit your desires.

6.  Will you directly cooperate with vehicle producers?

Yes, in every case where it will be possible including any license rights and fees and information right from source.


Our team

  Miro Markovic, founder and CEO of ThetaGifts

Miro is manager and businessman by nature and most of all he is service oriented as he believes customers deserve service (that includes great product as well).


  Max Markovic, quality check

Quality check is his business. He's six years old, but very much technically oriented. His first word wasn't "mom"or "mama", but "car". Everything what has mountable parts, cables, buttons, screws or looks technical is of his interest.


  Michal Kotoc, co-founder and financial manager

If you'd like to know how are your finances doing, just take Michal. He's well educated and experienced in financial analysis. He also worked as human resources manager.


   Jozef Antol, marketing director

Jozef's hobby and life is marketing. His policy is to buy new marketing book every month and study it. He also is very much skilled in internet marketing.


 Karolina Kralovicova, art design 

One wise man said artists will dream the dreams of society. Karolina is our art advisor and is checking all our designs (packaging, print materials, etc.)


  Jan Jedinak, software engineer

alias JJ. JJ knows his business and can program. If you need to repair something in matrix, just call him. Skilled in company systems, databases, e-shops, websites etc.


  Peter Markovic, graphic designer

If he takes his mouse and starts graphic programs on his monitors (even Houston would be ashamed)... I tell you he knows his business. He is taking care for preparations of our materials and graphics.




Gallery

story:
Für die deutsche Version des Videos bitte hier klicken >>

Jump to: The Product · Social Impact · Who we are · Risks and challenges · FAQ

Pitupi: a social business

The idea behind Pitupi is that a business transaction should be for the shared benefit of everyone involved--from the cotton farmer, to the tailor, to the buyer. We have a model where everyone gains and nobody's taken advantage of, and we've decided to create an alternative for the conscious consumer and the proactive parent, who care not only about their own needs but also about how their choices affect the lives of others–one garment at a time.

From left to right: our Tulip dress; our longsleeve t-shirt paired with our reversible kids bloomers.

The Product

We offer 7 distinct clothing categories. Each style below is available for purchase through the perks featured at the right of this webpage.

Pitupi Dresses from left to right: Petite, Longsleeve, & Tulip

From left to right: traditional neck baby body; round neck body; & Reversible hat

Pyjamas: two piece childrens (blue) and one piece baby (red)

Pants, from left to right: Baby bloomers; Straight-leg pants; Child bloomers with cuff. All reversible--pockets can be added at your choosing.

Pitupi Longsleeve Tees. Can be made with two snap fasteners at the shoulder for babies.

From left to right: Children's dungarees with pockets; Pitupi baby grow

Sizes and Materials

All clothes will be made out of fabrics from Turkey that are certified with the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS). By using only organic cotton we can produce garments that won't harm the planet or your child's skin.

The prototypes below reflect the general styles we will offer, with cheerful colors and cuts that are genuine children's clothes, rather than miniature adult clothes. Please note that some of the prints featured in the prototypes will not be initially available. To see official palette for the first round of production, go to our Indiegogo Archive (on the top of the page, just below the headline).

Every garment will be customizable: you will get to select color or print, as well as other details. See FAQ below for more info on how this works.

Our webshop will carry seven clothing categories: shirts, dresses, trousers, baby bodies, pyjamas, dungarees, baby grows, and finally, one sweet hat.

Sizes:

We offer baby sizes:
50/56 (age 0-2 months, UK 1)
62/68 (age 3-6 months, UK 2)
74/80 (age 6-12 months, UK 3)
86/92 (age 12-24 months, UK 4-5)

and children's sizes:
98 (age 2-3 years, UK 5-6)
104/110 (age 3-5 years, UK 6-7)
116/122 (age 5-6 years, UK 8-9).

Hat sizes include:

36; 38; 40; 42; 44; 46; 48; 50.

The Longsleeve-T and our baby bloomers

Step-by-step guide: How to order


Leading by example in kidswear

Our kids clothing company is committed to transparency, sustainability, and quality. We want to make a product people will love because of how it looks AND because of how it was made.

Dungarees; Petite dress & Straight pants

Baby body & Dungaree

We believe that with time, big business will follow our example, and the examples of other small businesses with similar values, so that this way of doing business will be the norm—not the exception. The fashion industry needs to be pushed.

Hopefully, the industry's predatory practices like sweat shops, wage dumping and “out of sight”-production will soon be shameful memories of the past. We believe that Pitupi could be a proverbial mouse that scares the herd of elephants into moving, slowly but surely, towards a higher standard.


Social Impact

Although all three co-founders have backgrounds in various NGO's, including the UN, Pitupi is not about charity. Rather, it's about creating a sustainable business model that shares benefits equally.

Our factory is based in Blinisht, Albania, which is a village in the north, near the city of Lezhë. The concept of "social business" has not yet found it's way to Albania, and many garment factories operate at a "produce at any cost"-philosophy; something which doesn't offer the community a fair compensation, considered the work that they put in.

The unemployment rate for working-age women in Albania is around 50%, and even higher for women who lack a formal education. For this reason, Pitupi will only hire women to work as our seamstresses. Furthermore, the minimum wage in Albania is 22,000 Lek (appr. 155 euros), but our seamstresses net income will be double that amount. This will empower them personally as well as support their entire community; beyond that, as a special perk to the employees we will also set up a fund to be invested in their children's education.

Drop us a line or head to our website for more info about this very important subject.


Our baby body, featuring a contrasting trim and easy-to-dress neckline

Where we are now

The project has been going on for a year, and so far we’ve done the following:

With your help, here is where we can go

As a contributor, you'll play a crucial role in getting us started. Before we can begin a larger scale production, we need to do the following:

Tailoring training course, spring 2015



Who we are

Founders

Comes from Germany, and has degrees from the University of Bolzano and from the University of Hamburg. She has worked with the UN in Africa and Asia, as well as several NGOs. She fell in love 12 years ago, not only with an Albanian man but also with the country.


Originally from Albania, but has lived in Sweden for several years now. He holds degrees from University of Turin and Malmö University as well as ten years of experience with business development and the banking. His passion is to bring sustainability and transparency to business operations.



Stefanie comes from Arizona in the US, but has lived in Sweden for five years. She has degrees from Lund University and the University of Arizona and has a background in copywriting and project management, having served several NGO's including the International Rescue Committee and Tamam Lund. She's also the social media voice of Pitupi.


Associates

If you want more information about our seamstresses visit our website: www.pitupi.de/faces

Additional ways to help

There are more ways to support Pitupi, besides contributing. You can tell your friends about us and share our campaign on social media. Check out the Indiegogo share tools featured to the left side of the campaign page.

Risks and challenges

Shipment time

Once we have ordered the materials, paid for by contributions from this campaign, we will have to wait 4-5 weeks for the fabrics to be printed and then shipped from Turkey. We've taken every effort possible to ensure the speediest results, but delays are still possible; especially in the beginning. However, we'll do everything in our power to make sure that all orders through Indiegogo and our webshop make it to your doorstep in a timely fashion.


FAQ and Details

How does the customization work?

You’ll go to our online shop where you’ll see our selection of standard children’s clothing styles. After deciding which garment you want, you will get to select a print, a stripe, or an all-over color, before finally choosing any add-on details. These details might include a contrasting border color on the neck and wrists, or the addition of pockets. Your customized order will then be sent to our factory, where one of our seamstresses will set to work on it.

What sizes do you offer?

We offer baby sizes:
50/56 (age 0-2 months, UK 1)
62/68 (age 3-6 months, UK 2)
74/80 (age 6-12 months, UK 3)
86/92 (age 12-24 months, UK 4-5)

and children's sizes:
98 (age 2-3 years, UK 5-6)
104/110 (age 3-5 years, UK 6-7)
116/122 (age 5-6 years, UK 8-9).

Hat sizes include:

36; 38; 40; 42; 44; 46; 48; 50.

How long does it take to receive an order?

Since every garment is custom made, Pitupi might naturally need a bit longer for shipping and production than what people might be used to in a consumer culture almost obsessed with speed. We hope to have a turn around time that can satisfy both the customer and our hard working seamstresses. We aim to have items ready and shipped within a 21 day window.

How does the transparency work?

First off, you’ll know exactly who made your product. By visiting our website's Faces page, you can check each seamstress' unique profile, hear about her background and future hopes, and see her photo. We might even be able to arrange for you to contact your seamstress directly, but language differences might presents a few challenges. Additionally, we plan to keep the factory doors open for scheduled visits.

We will also keep customers posted on who we buy our materials from, what certifications our fabrics carry, and how they were transported to our factory. We want you to be able to follow us through every step of the journey.

Last, but not least, cost breakdowns for each product will be made visible, where exactly how much of the price goes to materials, salaries, overhear costs and so on, will be on the website in plain sight.

What is your price range

Our items range from 19 euro to 39 euro, or 190kr to 390kr (SEK) retail.

What's your sales plan?

The first focus will be on the Swedish and German markets, because of our physical presence here, and also because of [the segments]. Our marketing strategy focuses on channels like social media, where we already have experience.

It is our hope that Pitupi will be able to expand beyond these two countries, into the EU, and eventually into larger markets like the United States.

What about the design?

Our current collection is designed by Anne Freitag, a German textile designer with an educational background in fashion design. Rather than regularly changing spring-fall collections—which we feel encourages over-consumption—we will work with Anne to make changes and updates as we go along; keeping the most well liked items while leaving less loved prints behind.

What certifications will the clothes carry?

Our most immediate certification goal is to become GOTS-certified. GOTS stands for Global Organic Textile Standard and certifies garments are made ethically, from organic materials, and in fair conditions. We cannot yet print the GOTS label on our clothing because we first need to have the factory reviewed and numerous criteria has to be met, but we look forward to pursuing this certification in due time.

Credits

A big thank you and shout out to the following people. Only with their help this campaign became what it is!
Film: Jann van Husen
Animations: Uwe Schweer-Lambers, www.uweschweerlambers.de
Graphics: Tina Paschetag, www.bueropaschetag.de

Jump to:   The Product  ·  Social Impact  ·  Who we are  ·  Risks and challenges  ·  FAQ 

Pitupi: a social business
The idea behind Pitupi is that a business transaction should be for the shared benefit of everyone involved--from the cotton farmer, to the tailor, to the buyer. We have a model where everyone gains and nobody's taken advantage of, and we've decided to create an alternative for the conscious consumer and the proactive parent, who care not only about their own needs but also about how their choices affect the lives of others–one garment at a time.From left to right: our Tulip dress; our longsleeve t-shirt paired with our reversible kids bloomers.








The Product
We offer 7 distinct clothing categories. Each style below is available for purchase through the perks featured at the right of this webpage. 

Pitupi Dresses from left to right: Petite, Longsleeve, & Tulip 

From left to right: traditional neck baby body; round neck body; & Reversible hat
Pyjamas: two piece childrens (blue) and one piece baby (red)
Pants, from left to right: Baby bloomers; Straight-leg pants; Child bloomers with cuff. All reversible--pockets can be added at your choosing.
Pitupi Longsleeve Tees. Can be made with two snap fasteners at the shoulder for babies.From left to right: Children's dungarees with pockets; Pitupi baby grow

Sizes and Materials
All clothes will be made out of 
fabrics from Turkey that are certified with the Global Organic Textile 
Standard (GOTS). By using only organic cotton we can produce garments 
that won't harm the planet or 
your child's skin.
The prototypes below reflect the general styles
 we will offer, with cheerful colors and cuts that are genuine 
children's clothes, rather than miniature adult clothes. Please note 
that some of the prints featured in the prototypes will not be initially
 available. To see official palette for the first round of production, 
go to our Indiegogo Archive (on the top of the page, just below the 
headline).
Every garment will be customizable: you will get to 
select color or print, as well as other details. See FAQ below for more 
info on how this works.
Our webshop will carry seven clothing 
categories: shirts, dresses, trousers, baby bodies, pyjamas, dungarees, 
baby grows, and finally, one sweet hat.
Sizes:
We offer baby sizes: 50/56 (age 0-2 months, UK 1)62/68 (age 3-6 months, UK 2)74/80 (age 6-12 months, UK 3)86/92 (age 12-24 months, UK 4-5)
and children's sizes:98 (age 2-3 years, UK 5-6)104/110 (age 3-5 years, UK 6-7)116/122 (age 5-6 years, UK 8-9).
Hat sizes include:
36; 38; 40; 42; 44; 46; 48; 50.


The Longsleeve-T and our baby bloomers
Step-by-step guide: How to order

Leading by example in kidswear
Our kids clothing company is committed to transparency, sustainability, and quality. We want to make a product people will love because of how it looks AND because of how it was made. 



Dungarees; Petite dress & Straight pants
Baby body & Dungaree
We believe that with time,
big business will follow our example, and the examples of other small businesses with similar values, so that this way of doing business will
be the norm—not the exception. The fashion industry needs to be pushed.
 Hopefully, the industry's predatory practices like sweat shops, wage dumping and “out of sight”-production will soon be shameful memories of the past. We believe
that Pitupi could be a proverbial mouse that scares the herd of elephants into
moving, slowly but surely, towards a higher standard.

seamstresses net income will be double that amount. This will empower 
them personally as well as support their entire community; beyond that, 
as a special perk to the employees we will also set up a fund to be 
invested in their children's education.
Drop us a line or head to our website for more info about this very important subject.

story:
We offer nothing, only the finest materials in constructing our watches. It is simply because you deserve a better quality of watch, affordably.

Attention to details that matters.

From the core of the watch, we choose extremely reliable Swiss Ronda movement as our watches’ brain, undisputed scratch resistant Sapphire Crystal Glass as our lens, and 316L surgical grade stainless steel as our durable case. Nevertheless, we believe that using genuine handcrafted Italian calf leather, tweed, and stainless steel mesh as our watch straps are the best choice to make. 

Reliability, consistency, and precision are the critical elements in choosing a watch movement. Therefore, we choose the renowned quartz Ronda 762 Swiss movement as the core of our masterpiece. As a leading watch’s heart maker from Switzerland, Ronda is well known of its undisputed quality, precision, and extremely long life battery which can last for years! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Quality and promises that matter.

We are confident on the quality of our watches, therefore, all watches offered by Nocturne are covered by a 3-year international manufacturing warranty. 

 

Need a versatile and perfect watch for every occasion? Here to unveil your answer.
With our "Quick Release" interchangeable straps, you can instantly switch the straps in split seconds. From black genuine leather straps to rose gold mesh straps; from business, gala dinner, to your casual beach visit or weekend gathering. 

Chopin 40 is all you need.

                                                                                                       

 

 

 

 

 

 

FOR FULL COLLECTION, PLEASE VISIT: https://www.nocturnewatch.com/collection/

               

 

FOR FULL COLLECTION, PLEASE VISIT: https://www.nocturnewatch.com/collection/

Dear backers: We are sincerely grateful to every contribution made by you and it is much appreciated, thank you!

 Each nocturne watch is made out of perfection for you to keep track on your precious time; it assists you to cherish every day and night. We strongly agree that everyone deserves a fine quality watch equipped with the best materials and components; meanwhile, without a luxury mark up. We are here to introduce Nocturne, a combination of excellent craftsmanship, world class quality materials, and affordable minimalist watch. 

What do we think about a watch? 

It is not only a tool for you to do time tracking, it is also a companion of your daily life, and a reflection of your personality. This good looking and versatile watch can elevate your image and make you look confident.

Nocturne. Crafted with Precious Time.

Isaac Hor

A menswear expert, watch lover, and passionate individual who is fascinated by minimalist creation, bespoke tailoring, and every single good thing. He strongly believes in "Less is More", while enjoy sharing his thoughts and knowledge of bespoke tailoring to everyone he knows. From the bespoke tailoring background, he understands the importance of versatility and finds out that a watch should looks versatile and exclusive as a bespoke garment that can be worn to any occasion, and most importantly, everyone deserves it.  He blends in the idea and expands his passion in exploring the definition of exceptional quality bespoke garments to wrist watch, this is how he involves into this exciting project and keep the flame alive.

SY Wong

A professional copywriter, TV industry player, and a lover of life. She always strives to do her best, never compromise nor give up, no matter in work or in life. By never stop exploring, she understands the importance of time and always believe that we are the only composer of our own life.

From her background, she clearly understand the importance of conveying and interpreting a correct message to audience. Moreover, she believes that time is precious, it is not only playing a role of interpreting every second but also keep on reminding us not to miss every single precious moment. After received the proposal by Isaac, she is certain that this is the perfect timing to spread their ideas into a fine creation, which is how Nocturne is formed.

This is the story of our team and we believe that we have a long journey to go. We are not alone if we can get your support along the way.

Your contribution means a lot to us, thank you !

Official Website

 http://www.nocturnewatch.com

Facebook

http://www.facebook.com/classywristarmor/

Instagram

http://www.instagram.com/nocturnewatch/
